text: I think sometimes a when people hear a place is great, it may influence the reviews they give it, and I think this place is an example of that.  This place serves okay food, has an okay wait staff, has average to high prices, but really does not live up to the many glowing reviews that it has, rather it appears most consistent with reviews like this, where it is okay, but not tremendous.  We ordered three pizzas for the 7 of us, and our opinions were all about the same, they were okay, but not great, one was truly sparse on the toppings.  The beers we ordered were good, but not cold and the glasses not chilled.
Fantastic food & drink. Great selection of lunch and dinner foods.   The patio seating and bar are fantastic.

I think this pizza is absolutely great to be honest.   I live in Arizona, and i'm always on the run because of my Job, and let me tell you, it's always good to have good fast food close by.Everything, from the texture of the dough all the way down to the sauce and crust itself was very much so pleasant.    Goin' out for pizza in the AZ area?I suggest this stuff right here.  5 out of 5 *****.

This place was excellent!  I went with a friend and we had the capresse salad, the bruschetta, and two pizzas. All were fantastic, the service was good and friendly. I would definitely recommend to friends and go back.
When I visited az again I came across this place..amaz! Great food. Great service. Great lasagna. # cheat day!
The pizza was prepared to perfection. Then the owner came out with lemoncello liquor shot that was delicious. The servers were amazing! This will be a regular date night spot for me and the honey.
nice atmosphere, great wait staff, and good pizza. the creme limoncello after dinner will definitely do the trick!

Excellent pizza, definitely one of the best I've had in the US (I am from Italy). The atmosphere was very friendly and the owner even offered some Italian dessert and his homemade pumpkin liquor. Really great food and great experience.

Awesome service and great pizza, super friendly staff.   I ordered a Toto Sapore and when it came and I saw it, it reminded me of some good Grimaldis pizza. Then I tasted it and I immediately noticed a difference. The bread was soft yet perfectly cris and the toppings was absolutely delicious and high quality.   The staff was great and we got to meet the manager because of a minor hiccup and he made sure we were more than satisfied at the end. That's a huge plus on customer service and a guarantee that we will tell our friends about this place.
Pizza is awesome, words simply cannot describe the orgasm going on in your mouth....true story folks!!!

Best pizza I have ever had. The principe is exquisite. The Ingredients are fresh, housemade, and high quality. The owner and chef Mateo is very hospitable and loves to visit with his customers. He even presented additional dishes and ingredients to try. Fantastic overall experience.
If you haven't been here, GO! First time I came here I returned twice in less than six weeks. It's as good as Bianco's without the three hour wait. Salud!
Great pizza, wine wonderful and fantastic service. The limecello and latte excellent.

As close as it gets to Italy. One of our favorite places in the Valley, Pomo never disappoints. Every pizza is superlative and the charming atmosphere - created by the sincerity of owner, host, and server alike - cause you to feel like you've come home. Start with the prosciutto-adorned cantaloupe and be sure finish with the complimentary house limoncello. Made from a fourth-generation family recipe, this delectable milky, citrusy goodness is the perfect way to end a fantastic meal.

The place is small but decorated well. I loved the pizza. The staff was fun and seemed proud of the restaurant. I've gone twice and each time the pizza was amazing. I tried the pizza that had four different toppings on different sections. It was a great sampler. It's probably my favorite pizza place in town. I actually like it better than Pizzeria Bianco in terms of taste and bigger menu.
Mauricio is delicious! Oh...and so is the pizza!  Always amazing and scrumptious and the special limoncello after dinner shot is better than dessert.

Just went there to celebrate a birthday and this place is outstanding.  I told the server and after a delicious pizza was pleasantly surprised with a canoli. The owner himself came over and it was all very nice.  The pizza I ordered was so good that I'm thinking about it now and can't wait to go back to try other things on the menu. Also would recommend trying the Blood orange drink.  Really enjoyed it!  Great place for a date and also a celebration, i.e. birthday or anniversary.  Highly recommend this restaurant and hope to return soon.

I've been to Italy a bunch of times, Naples included and I can safely say this is the closest I've ever experienced to true Neopolitan pizza in the US.  Really fantastic:  I had the Napoli pizza and it was just amazing.  Add to that the service, the extras (fried something or other and a very nice home made limoncello) and this place is an absolute winner.  Can't recommend it more highly.

This place is absolutely amazing.  Went with friends in from Chicago last weekend for the first time, we all loved it.  Went again last night with friends and they loved it too.  Right now it is my new favorite pizza in the valley.  Had the traditional margarita pizza both times .....so good.  The crust is so tasty...so happy to find a place like this here..

It's a nice place to go on a date or a girls night to have drinks and catch up. I went for my pick up order and as soon I walked in, the staff acknowledge me and offered something to drink while I waited for my order.

Pizza is ok, but not comparable with Pzzeria Bianco.  And since Pizzeria Bianco now has 3 locations and no more wait (at least not more than any other good restaurant) I rather go to Bianco any day of the week.    perhaps my mistake was that I went there with my wife on a "date"  we both love pizza and I just know that if I had taken her to Bianco she would have been happy, but after this place she hardly wanted to go for dates anymore.   The place is tiny. dark and was empty that night.   Service was great, the pizza is good, and certainly better than the average pie but not really that special  the ingredients are very good, but it was soggy in the middle.  But overall the ambiance is missing and the location is at least at night a bit lonely.

They make a de margarita . They make a de pizza pie  . You wanna de pepperoni or you wanna  de plain pizza pie .They make a de perfect pizza in them we all should  trust . you wanna  de thick pizza then go to pizza hut .  Primo Pomo Pizzeria  .

Pomo Pizzeria is absolutely fantastic to anyone that likes first rate Italian pizza/calzones that is made to order with fresh toppings on a light airy crust. In addition, the assortment of Italian sodas is terrific. I would highly recommend and will be going back very soon.

Absolutely the best pizza and service. I highly recommend the lodgiano pizza - not on the menu. A margarita base with delicious mushrooms and shaved cheese. Use the spicy olive oil to dip your slices and you're in heaven.

Probably the best pizza I have had in Phoenix. Everything was top-notch including the excellent service and the friendly manager who took great care of us. We started off with the bruschetta and it was delicious; fantastic balance of mozzarella cheese, crunchy bread and tomatoes. We followed that up with the Quattro Stagioni pizza, topped with Italian sausage, saut√©ed mushrooms, salame de Parma and olives; a combination so good I can't wait to go back and try it again. We ended the evening with a dessert made with Nutella that was chocolatey and decadent and to die for. To top off the evening the manager brought us a shot glass of Crema de Lemocello; The perfect ending to a wonderful meal.
First time trying Pomo last night. Quite a wait but completely worth it. Tip - you can call ahead and reserve a spot.

this is the BEST PLACE FOR PIZZA sorry Arizona this is the real thing the taste the cheese and the owner is great comes around and gives you this SHOT OF LIQUOR from Italy which is the DEAL SEALER!!!!   Dont expect some PAPA JOHNS style they have a small menu and the pasta is on another LEVEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! GO NOW

David the bartender is an awesome multi tasker. I sure wish i had an employee this talented and professional. The food has been wonderful so far. Fresh and imported ingredients. Even my body builder guy enjoyed the food.  Most of the time he is anti Italian food. Pomo has a great atmosphere in addition to pleasant people service and outstanding food
The food was unbelievably fresh and good! Love the vibe of this place and the staff was great!

Pomo is the best pizza in Phoenix. It is Naples pizza through and through, and the owner brings each guest a gratis cordial of his homemade creamy limoncello after each meal. It is not out of the ordinary to order one pizza per person. It is amazing. Get the Principe (the one with rocket on it.) Wow.
Attentive, friendly service and delicious food. Can't go wrong with the downtown Phx restaurant.

In town for business, and I would have never guessed such a welcoming and well crafted pizza place would be in Phoenix. Loved the wise guy, well layered with a great dough base. The atmosphere was perfect with a great ambiance and enough energy to make the place feel alive, but didn't leave you raising your voice to engage in conversation with companions.

I went in 10 minutes before closing. I was worried that I had come in too late to order. The waiter, Maurizio, was so gracious and accommodating. He said it didn't matter, they would make whatever I wanted. I wish I could remember what I ordered because it was the best pizza I have ever tasted. When I go back to Phoenix, I will be making a special trip back to this quaint pizzeria.

Yay x3 as I have found my new favorite restaurant in downtown phoenix! As a pizza lover, (i know, aren't we all), I was excited to give this place a try. My husband and I sat at their bar, and well, the service we had made us still feel like we were on our honeymoon. The bartender was great, and the food...EVEN BETTER! It sealed the deal when we had the FREE limoncello and warm, sugar-powdered dough chips. Who doesn't like free sweet treats?  If you haven't tried this place yet...What on earth are you waiting for? Your tongue and tummy will not be disappointed.

Recently had a wonderful dinner here! We started off with an order of bruschetta, which was incredibly fresh. Then we each had a personal pizza, the Regina Margherita and the Pomo. All of the ingredients were perfection and the dough was nice and thin. While we were waiting on our tiramasu (which was incredible) the head chef Matteo brought us a cinnamon liqueur that tasted like Cinnabon in a shot! The service was great, the patio was pleasant, and the food could not have been better.

Tasty, if pricey. Four people. Four pizzas - all came out one after the other. Great thin crust. Tasty toppings. Only thing that kept me from giving this "top of everyone else's list" establishment five stars is the pricing. A simple 13" pizza should not be $15-$18.

Simply amazing.  Three friends and I came by Pomo on a Saturday night around 7:30. Most of the tables were full, but we didn't have to wait. We opted to eat outside even in winter as it was a nice night and the space heaters provided plenty of heat. We loved the feel of the place.  We ordered the bruschetta to start, and it was delicious. It was especially divine with the spicy olive oil drizzled on top.  We ordered two pizzas: the Principe with prosciutto crudo, fresh arugula, and shaved parmigiano and the Toto Sapore with Italian sausage, pancetta, salame piccante and prosciutto cotto.  Between the four of us, there was enough food to share. We loved being able to try two different pizzas. The Principe was delightful - especially the thinly sliced prosciutto. I had it with some of the spicy olive oil, which made it perfect. We all also enjoyed the Toto Sapore. The meats were delicious. All the ingredients on both pizzas were of great quality.  To end the night we ordered a tiramisu to split. The slice was large and perfect for each of us to have a good sized piece. We also enjoyed the little pieces of heaven they bring to everyone at the end of the meal - thin and crispy fried dough pieces covered in powdered sugar. The owner also brought out another dessert even after all of that - some sort of yummy cake with mascarpone. We were happy!  Price is decent too. For the four of us, included tip, we each paid $15.  Will definitely be back again for the good pizza, dessert, service, and atmosphere.

Love, love, loved it! This place is a home-run. My husband and I have become Neapolitan-style pizza connoisseurs over the past few years. Pomo pizzeria is the real deal with lots of authentic Italian ingredients & flavors. Any place that serves oregano in a shaker on the table is authentic Italian.   We were disappointed that the Sicilian arancini is not served at the downtown location, but settled for the Mista salad, which is a perfect, light starter. The owner dropped off a thick balsamic vinegar to add to it... divine.   For the main course, we ordered our standard - the Bufala Verace (basically Margherita with Bufula mozzarella). And it was fantastic, must order this! We also ordered the Cappiccosa - also delicious, but one slice was enough for me, and I was back to the Bufula.  Sauce is generous, but not excessive. Crust is thin & light, but thick enough to hold the slice & eat without knife & fork.   The native Italian staff was friendly and the Southern Italian owner delivering the complimentary crisps & limoncello (best we've ever had, by the way) really put a nice finishing touch on our meal.

Sat at the bar and staff was very friendly and attentive - providing recommendations when I was ordering and always checking to see if I need anything else or refills.  Had the Principe Pizza (prosciutto + arugula) and it tasted very fresh with a great balance of sauce, cheese and ingredients on an amazing crust.  The owner also brought me a free plate of fried dough with powdered sugar as dessert towards the end. Who can say no to free desserts??

Wonderful place! Love the Pepino pizza! The service was absolutely wonderful! They were quick to get the pizza out to you. The powdered sugar dessert was delicious. Love the service, they know how to keep their customers happy!!

- definitely a date place, romantic but a bit busy in a fun way - great service and server, fast, attentive, charismatic - GREAT pizza, i say that as a pizza snob - its a bit small, so i wouldn't go there with more than 4-6 (max) ppl
This place was delicious! The pizza was great with lots of authentic choices. I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well! The complementary fried dessert was the perfect end to a great meal!

I think I'm starting to take this place for granted - shoot I almost decided to give this place 4 stars instead of 5 because I don't get quite as excited as I used to about this place since I have been here too many times and it is no longer "a treat"....what was I thinking.  Anywho, the pizza here is amazing Neapolitan style pizza.  I think they've even been certified by some Italian Neapolitan association (along with only a couple other places in the Valley) that relates to the methods of cooking the pizza - so that's pretty cool I guess?  Does it make the pizza taste any better than the Italian style Pizza down the street? Who knows, but it clearly isn't hurting!    If I had ever been to Italy this would also be the section of the review where I ramble on about how it reminds me of that little Pizza joint just outside of Naples I went to and yadda yadda.  Check it out for yourself - I don't care if you are a deep dish person it is worth it.

This is my favorite pizza place in downtown phoenix! I've had the chance to try quite a few since I live downtown, but this restaurant has the freshest ingredients and most inviting staff. I love coming here!

I used to live about 25 ft from this restaurant when it was formerly  Sens.  Let's just say, I am glad I no longer live 25 ft away from it being Pomo-I might have gained 100lbs!    As far as pizza in downtown Phoenix goes, I know everyone loves Pizzeria Bianco.  However,  please try Pomo when you just can't fathom waiting 2 hours to eat.  You will not be disappointed!  The pizza is delicious and the owner is absolutely the nicest guy I have encountered in the restaurant industry.  Like many other reviews here, we received the complimentary Iimoncello and fried bread for dessert. Yum!   The owner overheard me saying to my group that I really wanted a different dessert than what we were going to order.  He came out and surprised me with it for free!   We were all so grateful and impressed- please enjoy this awesome downtown restaurant!  The food is wonderful, and the service is beyond excellent.

Was back in town and a friend suggested pomo again. This time it was plain bad. The pizza came out fast but it tasted too salty and the tomato sauce was very sour. Pretty good service but with high prices and bad pizza I won't go back.

I'll start by saying the food was delicious: my boyfriend and I each got pizza and they were really good. But the service was awful. Fifteen minutes after being seated, we still hadn't been served. We never really had a waiter: a man (who I think was the manager?) ended up taking our order and, although he was really nice, he was busy with his other work so we never really saw him again until the end of our meal. By contrast, the table across from us had two servers: a server who did his normal duties and another server who they seemed to know and who came to the table to chat, no exaggeration, about every five minutes. I actually thought she was just part of their party at first since she sat down with them a few times. It was odd, since there seemed to be so many servers on duty to be completely ignored. I loved the food, but I just felt like I overpaid for such an irritating experience. I'd suggest takeout, since eating in is an exercise in frustration (unless you know one of the waiters personally)

Really enjoyed the food and service at Pomo! We shared the grilled veggie app and a pizza with ricotta, salami and sausage - both GREAT. Our waitress was very nice and I loved that the owner came to our table after the meal with a complimentary fried dough dessert and shots of a yummy cinnamon drink that he made. We'll be back!

Stopped in on our way to a concert based solely on the appearance of the inviting patio. Duvel on tap, nice decor and some very tasty pizza. The owner even stopped by to check on us. I'll be back for sure!
First of all the service was really good. Our drinks never hit empty. Our food was out in a timely manner and did not disappoint. Pizza was great and the Pana Cota is excellent. Eat it!!
Great Pizza but the service was even better!  The staff could not have been more accommodating.  I will definitely come back again.

Not sure what the bad reviews are about. I have been coming here since they opened this downtown location. The food here is amazing and authentic which is how you would get it in Italy... The dough is amazing and it's a secret on how he makes it! The pizza is awesome and the deserts are great too. The employees here always welcome me and the owner always makes a point to shake my hand and say hi. It does get busy here at times but the service has always been good. The complimentary fried dough with powder sugar and the limoncello is a nice touch! Try this place out I'm sure you will love it!

OMG first time eating here and everything we had was amazing: bruschetta, salad, pizza, pana cotta, cannoli, coffee and after all that the owner gave us a a shot if their homemade limoncello.  Our server was very friendly. Next time I'm in downtown Phoenix this place is a must!!

Did I land in Italy? This place is great. Delicious...from the salad to pizza to wine to dessert. And great service too. I've been happy EVERY trip I've made here. It's pretty small, so don't be surprised if there's a wait on a weekend night...everyone else wants to go here too!
Food was so good. Little pricey on the wine selection and when asked if we would like the bread with olive oil, the waiter didn't mention there was a cost to receive it.

Best pizza in AZ!! Just got back from Naples and this is right on point with my local joint Acqua Farina. Love all the small touches and perfect service. I wish they had the same access to seafood though!!

Don't write many reviews but had to for this place. Amazing first impression !!!. It is authentic, friendly, tasty, and satisfying.  So glad it's in downtown.  I hope to become a regular at this restaurant.

The more I visit this downtown pizzeria, the more I'm convinced it can compete for best Neapolitan in the city. Pomo offers a really great combination of flavors that results in an entirely satisfying experience.   The pizza is made in a traditional wood fired oven and it really shows in the lightly charred and spotted crust. The flavor in the crust itself is solid, and it serves as a well textured base to the pizza. The thinness of the crust is perfect for Neapolitan pizza. My only dislike here is the lack of oven spring on the ring of the crust, as the crust seems to have lost some gas somewhere along the way.   The sauce at Pomo is the centerpiece of the pizza. Pomo delivers a bright and simple tomato sauce with well-balanced acidity which blends itself into slices of fresh mozzarella. There's a great ration of cheese-to-sauce, as Pomo avoids a tendency of some Neapolitan places to undercheese the pie. The cheese avoids any unwanted browning and mixes really well into the overall flavor profile.   Pomo's Principe introduced me to the magic of prosciutto and arugula and I've yet to find a place that does it better. If you're not loving the slightly steeper prices on some of the pizzas, you can't go wrong with their margherita either.   Pomo matches the quality of their pizza with attentive service and a friendly and generous owner. One negative however- the "house bread" looked and tasted like it came out of a sandwich bread bag. Not the level of effort I expected after tasting their pizza. However, even that's not enough to prevent me from giving it a 5-star rating.  If you're looking for some of the best pizza in Phoenix and would like to avoid the line at Bianco's, Pomo is nearby and serving their own Neapolitan pizza on par with almost anything else you'll find.

Wow  What a fantastic pizza, light and crunchy crust. Sweat sauce with just the amount of topping and cheese.  Very authentic Italian atmosphere complete with a shot of a sweat liqueur at the end of the meal.  Highly recommend this restaurant for those people from out of town who want a light meal.

Have been here a few times but this time was particularly great. My roommate and I came up for a quick snack after studying and had a really nice time. Great ambiance and welcoming staff! Especially our bartender, I think his name was Clay? Was super knowledgeable on the ingredients and menu. Helped us pick out a great pizza and kept us entertained :) we will definitely be back!

Last time my husband and I went here gave it 5 stars.  Tonight dropped family off at airport and decide to go by myself instead of battling traffic.  Ordered a bottle of wine, bur-rata and a white pizza. The pizza came out first which was fine because I told him it was fine for them both to come out together but he did not bring me any olive oil.   The wine bottle came to my table already opened.  The waiter did not even pour my first glass for me or any  after.  I asked for it to be corked when I was finished with my meal, he pulled  a cork from his apron and put it on the table.  Since it was plastic I could not cork it my self, another waitress brought it inside to the bartender to cork.  My waiter brought my bottle out with a broken cork that was not the origin to my wine.  To make things worse I never got my limoncello!  I know I sound bratty but I am a teacher on a Friday night just expecting good service
I love Pomo. The pizza, wine selection and desserts never disappoint. Great atmosphere as well. I am so glad this restaurant is close to home.
Staff is not friendly and the look on the person who brought us out food was like I hate you and my job.  I do have to say best pizza in town. Salads are fresh and the dressings are homemade.

Simply delicious!! Amazing does not even begin to describe the food, all of it is hand made with the highest quality and expertise!! Highly recommend!! Please stop by and enjoy the Italian family atmosphere!

Delicious and fresh salad and pizza ! We shared the mista salad. Fresh greens, cucumber and grape tomatoes with thinly sliced Parmesan cheese. Then we ordered a pizza 1/2 and 1/2 the Pomo and the contadina. Service was excellent!

OMG!  I love this place.  I loved it when it was in Scottsdale!  I lived in Italy and if feels like I am in a pizzeria  there.  The authentic ingredients, the 90 second baking in the authentic oven...the sauce...I LOVE IT!  And I love the owner..he is so funny!  I recommend this place.  If I lived downtown I'd be here ALL the time.  Can't wait for the new Scottsdale location to open again.  Bravo!!!

Automatically garners 5 stars,My family and I visited this location and had a great meal and time! , The food was fantastic and the service was friendly helpful ,They have excellent customer service ,I love coming here, Love the food!!,Will be back for sure.....
If you're looking for great pizza in Phoenix this is the place to go. Everytime I go I am reminded of the pizza in Naples. Amazing! Pizza is spot on! I recommend the Diavola or the Bufala Verace.

Due to an early dental appointment I was only able to have the tomato soup. It was excellent!!! My coworker had the Quattro? Pizza which looked great and he commented that it was good. He ate the whole thing. A bit pricey here but is worth it. Also a hipster type feel as well.

Best Pizza Ever.  Maybe the only real pizza I've ever had, now that I know what authentic napoletana tastes like.  the Chef and waitress were both extremely kind, and offered us desserts on the house =]  I've never been this sad when my tummy got full, cuz I couldn't enjoy any more of the most delicious pizza taste that I have ever experienced.
Loved the Panini...the bread is make there and ingredients is fresh..You gotta try this restaurant!

Delicious wood fired pizza with maxing key friendly staff. Great bottle of wine. All topped off with complementary, homemade Lemoncello. Perfect dinner after all day hiking. This was our first trip but made it onto the "must return" list.
This is our second time here and it only got better since our last visit. Best pizza in the valley. Try their organic Italian sodas with the pizza and be prepared to fall in love.

Absolutely fabulous experience tonight. My wife and I have been two other times, but couldn't wait for 1.5 hours for a table. Tonight we could have had a table but chose to be seated at the bar.  Our server, Amber, was attentive and gave us excellent recommendations. My wife had an Aperol Spritz (a drink she had in Italy this summer), and I stuck to red wine.   We started out with the bruschetta, she had the capriossa pizza and I had the diavola pizza. Each pizza was superb. Instead of red pepper flakes, they have this red pepper flake oil that is divine. The owner came by the drop off freshly grated Parmesan that was to die for along with Italian dried herbs that we did not use.   Following our meal, we were treated to some complimentary pizza crusts topped with cinnamon and sugar.   Will absolutely return to this gem in downtown.  Ciao!
Not only is this the best pizza in Phoenix, it's among the best I've ever had (and I have spent a few weeks in Italy). And we got free lemoncello!

Every part of the dinner was exquisite.  Not only is this authentic, it is delicious. We started our evening with cocktails and an amazing bruschetta. Our server, Kathryn was poised and knowledgeable.  All of the ingredients are flown in from Italy.  We followed up with two pizzas. Each was remarkable.  Finally we shared one of the best panna cotta we've ever had. But wait!  Just as we thought we were done, out comes the owner with  a creamy limoncello.  We will definitely be back. This place knows how to do things. GREAT JOB!
First timer. Brought my little girls in. Staff was great. Pizza was authentic and tasty. Fresh ingredients. The chef even brought something out special for the girls.

I love this place!  And to have it downtown now is perfect... I don't have to go all the way to Scottsdale.  My boyfriend and I went after the gym Sunday afternoon.  We were headed to Matt's breakfast, but it was packed.  I got the bufalo pizza, he got the trio (or one with lots of meat), both perfect as usual!  Love the food here.  So far my favorite pizza in town.  There are so many downtown all a little different and thankfully with Pomo here I don't have to wait in line at Bianco anymore.
Amazing atmosphere, drinks, and food! Will recommend to anyone visiting Phoenix. Thank you.

Well let's just say I was not impressed. The food was just okay. I had the lasagna. The main problem I had was they don't offer a side salad and when I asked if they could put a little salad on the plate with my lasagna they refused! Seriously and you call yourself an Italian restaurant. I don't think so. Also, very expensive. Not at all worth it.

Claiming "imported Italian Porcini mushrooms" is misleading when the mushrooms clearly came from a can and were literal piles of brown goo. They were inedible, and I tried. The sauce also tasted canned, which is fine, but at least spice it up a bit with some Italian herbs, right? I also wish the basil had been added fresh and not cooked on top. The crust was good though and the owner was very friendly.
I love this restaurant! This Pomo Pizzeria has the best service and is very fast and friendly. It totally deserves a 5 star rating. Definitely my favorite place to get pizza

I am Italian/American and expect authentic Italian when I try a new restaurant. And this was a pleasant surprise! Nice setting and very good, friendly staff. Owner is a real gentleman! You too will be impressed! Worth a visit...
Gorgeous atmosphere, good prices and excellent recipes. Almost feel like i'm in Neaples. Definetly i'll be back.

After a date to the Phoenix Symphony, we walked a bit to find this small and well reviewed pizza place. We had never been until tonight.   This may be my new favorite restaurant. It's so phenomenal that even writing this review creates a division in me because I want to keep it a secret BUT more than that I want it to thrive.   Wow. Literally the best service I've had possibly in my life, the freshest caprese salad of my life, easily one of the top 3 pizzas of my life (we ordered the pomo which is mushrooms, red bell peppers, onions, and sausage... It's much better than it sounds) and some very good ambiance.   We ate outside and the weather happened to be ideal. (March nights are great) The bar next door had enjoyable live music too. I am shocked that this place is all around as great as it is.  If you can, stop by with an open mind and an empty stomach. You will not be disappointed. Possibly best of all, the bill for both of us to eat very well: 26 bucks.  Wow.   *standing ovation* Bravo! Encore!
Best new place in Phoenix. Our Authentic Italian pizza was unbelievable, our beers were cold and dessert was to die for.

My friends and I love pizza and we decided to try this place that we have heard so much about.  We arrived at 7:00P to an already full restaurant and put our name on the list.  They said it was about a half hour wait so we went to the bar and ordered drinks and waited for our table.  The bartender was friendly, efficient and engaging.  In almost exactly 30 minutes our table was ready and we went outside to the patio to be seated.  Our charming young waitress was Celine (as in Dion) and was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped us make some choices.  We ordered two kinds of bruschetta as appetizer while we continued to enjoy the downtown scene and our cocktails and conversations.  The bruschetta arrived and was covered in contents!  Delicious!!  We quickly devoured then ordered our pizzas from friendly Celine.  The pizza here is Neopolitan style (very thin crust).  They arrived in no time and each one looked and tasted amazing.  I can't pronounce the names but we had three different ones plus the Mista salad and each was done perfectly!    After dinner while we were enjoying ourselves and finishing up, the owner of the restaurant came by with a tiny after dinner desert plate consisting of what seemed like pastry of some kind with powdered sugar on it.  Nothing fancy, but a nice complimentary gesture they do for every guest after dining.  On top of that he brought out four little shot glasses and began to pour a yellowish mixture from a bottle.  He said it was his own blend of lemoncello and cream and he thanked us for coming in and said he hoped we would be back.  What a nice finishing touch to an already wonderful meal.  The shot glass size lemoncello/cream was delicious and something I had never thought about combining.  Celine came back again to thank us for coming in and urged us to come back again.  This will definitely be added to our regular pizza dining experience in the future!

One of my favorite pizza joints in AZ. Decor and ambiance makes for a nice date night or even a casual lunch/dinner outing. Our service is always outstanding. the Bufala pizza is a must try! simple ingredients and full of flavor.

This place is my favorite restaurant next to Cibo, because if one gets flooded with tourists, the other can be a backup. This place offers quality pizza and great cannoli. They even have this food (I don't really know what it's called) that's easy to chew and taste like nothing so it's basically a vehicle for powdered sugar and chocolate sauce. These are the reasons why I think Pomo is a great restaurant. Stop reading this review now.
Great dinner last night at Pomo! Wish this little gem was in OC. Everything from wine, salad, pizza to the limoncello and sugar dough was spot on!

I know I'm like the hundredth person to post  about this place but its worth it. This place rivals pizzeria Bianco for the best pizza in Phoenix. Which is saying something.  We got here and the places was slammed. Sat down and service still kept up. Food was awesome. And they hook you up with free fry bread and lemoncello at the end of the meal. This place is nuts everyone should be here.

This is a very special place, possibly the best pizza in Phoenix. I waited too long to write a review, so I can't give as much detail as I'd like.  I had the Don Alfonso, with sausage, red peppers, and salame piccante ferrarini. It was fantastic. Every element was extremely high quality. The pizza was flawless and delicious.  I had come in after 1:30, so the place was quiet and I got to interact with the owner. He was extremely friendly. At the end of the meal, he brought some free dessert -- they were flaky, crispy frybread-like things, dusted with powdered sugar. Excellent. (Sorry I don't remember the name of the pastry.)  For me, it helps to place them on a scale compared to other gourmet pizza restaurants. Here's the breakdown: Pomo is better than The Parlor, Il Bosco (in Scottsdale), and Hungry Pie (Scottsdale).  The only places that could compete with Pomo are Bianco and Piazza al Forno in Glendale. It's been so long since I've been to Bianco that I just don't know - I'd need to go there again. Piazza al Forno is the only place where I remember feeling the way I did when I was Pomo - where I was hit by a train, where my life was interrupted by this sense of "Holy shit, this is not a normal Phoenix upscale hipster pizza place (which are, admittedly, pretty good). This is a whole different ride."

First time. Nice atmosphere. The food was good - but missing a little something too, flavor-wise. I also thought the presentation could have been better. That said, we will occasionally return and test out other menu items and see where it leads us!

Hey Yall...I would have given this joint 5 stars and posted this amazing picture of this lasagna, but because  I am all about  free...I didn't receive fried dough nor my free limoncello...I'm not even pissed that I had to send my cool temperature lasagna back because it taste awesome. However the lack of my free ness cost this is amazing picture of this amazing food. Then I ordered the Panna Cotto and my life changed...INSERTS ANGEL...the joint is totally freakin awesome. Oh with my dessert arrived my limoncello this limoncello...it sinfully disrespectfully delicious I felt like I was stealing something while I was drinking it never a good sign, truly an orgasmic experience..even though there are 17 waitresses they work and move in sync like a Olympic  Swim Team...kudos ladies!!! Asking me if I will come again is not the question... the question is how soon will I return...ASAP
Came for dinner before going dancing. Nice chill vibe with pretty good cocktails. I tried their calzone & it was really good; authentic brick oven taste.

The service was great, don't get me wrong.  However, I was really disappointed with the food, we ordered the Caprese and a Margarita with mushrooms. The Caprese came out first and the tomatoes and mozzarella were really poor quality. It's not like I don't realize tomatoes are out of season but they could really do better than that. The mozzarella was just bad over all, the texture and taste. Seeing as how bad the mozzarella was, I had our waiter change the cheese on our pizza to the buffalo mozzarella which was like 3$ more just to hope it would turn out better. Our pizza arrived, I expected the buffalo mozzarella to be a bit more watery, but our pizza was literally flooded with the water from the buffalo mozzarella and was a nightmare.  I don't drive all the way out to Phoenix often, and I usually just do it to go to nice restaurants I find on Yelp. Such as Bianco, Matts, and Atoyac; and I always seem to have a good time and experiance at all of these but this place let me down.

Had one of my all time favorite dining experiences here.  My sweetie and I sat at the kitchen table, had great drinks, and shared a delicious pizza. We split a tasty dessert, and we're surprised with complimentary Limoncello shots.   Left tipsy, satisfied and delighted. On par with 4 star places that cost 3x as much.

I can't in good faith give this place more than 3 stars. I'm actually pretty surprised there are so many 5 star reviews. Nevertheless here is my opinion and experience here.   We arrived right when they opened at 11 and put enough money in the meter for an hour and fifteen minutes. All the while my boyfriend laughed at me for wasting my change on being over zealous. We were the only guests thus far and were seated right away. Everything was clean and nice as far as tables, chairs and decor.   We got 2 waitresses as one was training. Having never been here we decided to try the meat, cheese, and olive platter. I was excited for it to bring back memories of my grand parents from Sicily. We waited, and waited, and another table was seated next to us. We waited some more and our waitresses returned to take our main course order. We were told to try the margarita pizza and regaled with tales of being certified all the way from Italy itself, which I can only assume, is the justification for the pricing. The sauce is even out of a jar shipped all the way from Italy itself. However, our pizza would supposedly be cooked in sixty to ninety seconds (yes, that's what she said) so at least we wouldn't be waiting?   Finally our appetizer arrived with paper thin (warm) bread. The bread was inviting and the olives were great. That's about all the praise I can dish out for the meat tray. Even my boyfriend who, being a typical American male, lives for meat and cheese trays, was disappointed. Granted it was a lot of food. There wasn't enough bread for the whole tray. So if you're a party you might want to ask for extra bread if you decide on this lack luster adventure.   By this time the restaurant had filled and tables around us were chattering away and eating. Yet we sat, and sat. About 45 minutes after we arrived our pizza came to the table, while everyone around us was finishing their lunch.   I will be honest. It looked sad. Sauce everywhere, barely any cheese, and small pieces of basil that adorned 2.5 slices of the 6. I stared at it for a few minutes before taking a slice and trying a bite. My fears were substantiated tasting sauce out of a can or jar that had traveled half way around the world on a barge, probably next to a container of leather flip flops, and crates of Nutella.   I learned to make a five hour sauce from my grandmother. I'm quite frankly appalled that a self proclaimed Italian pizzeria is not making their own sauce.   Five minutes after our pizza arrived a man came and put a container of cheese an oregano on the table. My boyfriend dumped some cheese on his slice and said "try some, it'll help." I tried and decided it was no use.   For dessert we tried the Nutella cake. While it didn't taste much like Nutella (more chocolate), the strawberries and whipped cream were phenomenal.   I can't say that I'd make the trek again for strawberries and whipped cream. If we return it'll be for sauce less pizza only.
I like to keep it simple with pizza, and the Sauce and crust are perfect. Wish they had better wine prices, but overall very good pizza.

I had been looking so forward to dining here, and was not the least bit disappointed.  The service was incredibly friendly, the food delicious and the ambience cozy enough.  Our server might have been new as I ended up having to open the bottle of wine for her.  A funny moment, though I can imagine some stuffy customers not being so patient.  The night was capped off by a visit from the owner with two shots of limoncello and some delicious powdered sugar covered fried dough.  My lovely date and I argue to this day about what they were called.

Pomo, I love you.  The dinning experience at Pomo was amazing.  Although the restaurant was fairly busy, we received our pizza's very quickly. The pizza's were hot and delicious.  The service was exceptional and it didn't hurt that our waiter was Italian; his accent was delicious ;)

I love this place. My fave is the Zuppa al Funghi - its amazing! Pizza is yummmmy. The owner interacts with every customer whether delivering the pizza personally or checking in on you or bringing you the creamy limoncello at the end. Nice outdoor seating out front. It's nice to sit at the bar and watch the guys make your pizza too!! Definite date night kinda place.

Great draft beer options and cold glasses!  I consider myself a Neopolitan Pizza aficionado and this place blew me away. I had the Principe and couldn't stop eating. Can't wait to come back and try the others. The staff was beyond nice. Try to grab a seat at the pizza bar to watch perfection while you eat and drink.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
Even when this place isn't quite on their 'A' game, it's still tremendous.  Hats off to Pomo and all the other great pizza places showing up in the Valley.

The Phoenix Zagat gives this place a 26.  Wow, Zagat inflation!   For a New Yorker like me, a rating like that is reserved for places like Blue Hill or Babbo.  This a New York Zagat 20.  This is an LA (my new home) Zagat 22.    The food is good but not amazing.  The bruschetta was tasty but bland; my wife and I had to dump salt all over it to bring it to life.  The burrata salad was also good.  It too lacked a bit of salt but was tasty.  The burrata was nice and fresh.  The pizza is the real winner on the food front.  We had the Pomo (sausage, peppers, mushrooms) and it was amazing, not to mention fast -- the pizza was ready in 90 seconds.  The sauce had just the right amount of acidity and the dough was perfect--decliciously crispy with just the right amount of salt.    The service also deserves a special mention.  The bartender (a short fellow with a pony tail) was awesome.   He was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.  The waitresses -- meh, the opposite -- they were just ok.  Also, the owner/manager offered us Limoncello (albeit in an EVERCLEAR bottle) which we passed on.  My days of drinking grain alcohol (or whatever it was) are long gone.  Nice touch nonetheless.  Three issues:  I encountered not one but two hairs during my meal.  One long one on my glass of ice water, and a short one in my salad.  Nasty but it happens and I didn't make anything of it.  The third:  the bathroom was in shambles.  No soap, no towels.  I expect better from any restaurant, let alone one a Zagat 26 (hah).  Probably a result of it being Super Bowl eve.  I told one of the waitresses about the issue and when I returned later the soap issue was fixed, the towels, not so much.  Training issue.  All in all, not a bad spot if you're in Phoenix.
Pomo continues to be one of our favorite restaurants.  Great food and service.  For a superb experience, sit at the bar and ask for David!  Thank you Pomo for another tremendous night!

A neat joint close to PHX relatively quite downtown. Located next to a bar, this is a small place with seating both indoor and outdoor. Menu selection was simple and we chose veg. lasagna and buffalo brasca along with Classico Chianti wine. The pizza was served hot with fresh cheese and lasagna was flavorful. We were amazed at the freshness and authenticity of food. To finish it off, the owner (presumably) offered us grain alcohol to go with crispy powered sugared wafers. These were complementary. Overall, amazing service and quality of food.

We came here late after a volleyball tournament with our kids and were absolutely blown away.  This is authentic Italian pizza.  Everyone in my family loved the food. My wife and I have both been to Italy and this is as good as anything you would find in the best pizza locations in Sicily... Great, friendly service too!!

This is the significant other's fav pizza spot.  We've gone twice in the last three weeks.  The pizza crust is thin, slight charred and tasty.  The ingredients are always fresh.  I had the pollo salad and it was surprisingly delicious for something so healthy.  We sat at the bar once, and the bartender(female) was very knowledgeable about wines.  If I opened a bar, I'd steal her away.  ;)  When we sat at the table, the waiter was very attentive. The owner always gives us complimentary and to die for creamy limoncello.  Thank you!

Best pizza in Phoenix! The owner and chef is actually Italian, so he really knows what he is doing. Their tomato sauce for the pizza is fresh and tasty, their secret: san marzano tomatoes. Blown away every time I go. The desserts are quite good too, try the semi-fredo, wow!! The owner will also serve limoncello at the end of your meal. A must try in Phoenix.
best pizza ever!  I've tried pizza in many states and this 90 second pizza is AMAZING!   Best I've ever had.  you must try for yourself.

One more visit for Pomo. This time super busy and i am not surprise pizza is outstanding and service even when packed is prompt and  fast. we tried new summer menu with bruschetta Trio delicious (smoked salmon, pate' olives, mushrooms) then we go through swordfish carpaccio outstanding flavor and end it with pizza porcini so good. Their porcini are from italy (if you like mushroowms pizza with porcini is must). Complimentary strip dough and cinnamon cream (pure heaven).

Sooo good! I am really picky with pizza. I have gone to all of the suggested spots. This pizza is my favorite. The crust is thin and crispy on the outside, the sauce is flavorful! We went for lunch with toddlers so we had to get the pizza to go when the stuff started hitting the fan but it was still great when we got it home. The only thing that I didn't like was the appetizer of grilled veggies. It was completely tasteless and not grilled enough and gross but who cares when the pizza is that amazing. It really is like pizza in Italy. I can't wait to go back!
Excellent.  Great service -- attentive, but not overly so.  Every morsel of food was wonderful.  Also, really like the neighborhood vibe -- it felt warm and friendly.  Go!
This was my first time in this restaurant and I have to say that I was amazed at both the service and food. I would recommend this to anyone in Phoenix heading downtown.  We will be back for sure!

One of two authentic pizza places in downtown Phoenix, which also serves salad and panini sandwiches.  In addition to the dining room there is a dedicated outdoor seating area right off the sidewalk, which are both clean and well arranged.  This being my first visit i wanted to try something different, so I ordered a Capri Panini.  The panini was large and was similar to a folded pizza. The "bread" is made from the same dough as the pizza, and cooked in the same ovens so it is fresh and crisp.  The roasted vegetables and mozzarella were ample and flavorful.  Although this sandwich was very good, it did have one issue...The protein.   The sausage could not hold it's own with the other flavors in the sandwich.  At one point I even questioned whether they had forgotten to put it in at all and opened half of the sandwich to find only a few small "coins" of sausage.  In my estimate, there was less than a half of sausage in the entire sandwich.  I understand that the secret of preparing food is to balance flavors, however, if the diner is left searching for the "star of the show" then in the end it is a failure.  My guest had the Contadina pizza which looked great and he was very happy with it.   I will return to try the pizza.
We had a very friendly Italian waiter from Roma and the food was great. The Bruchetta had wonderful fresh baby tomatoes.
Good pizza is judged first by the crust, then by the sauce, cheese and toppings.  Five stars on all.
Fast and I mean fast service. Sat down at the bar and ordered a pizza. Less than 5 minutes I was heading out the door with my piping hot pie. Decent flavor, good crust. I'll be back.

I've been to Italy and Eataly in Chicago and Pomo is up there with them for the best pizza I've ever had. It is almost identical to Authentic Italian pizza. The atmosphere and food may not be great for younger kids. The service is good however can be slow. Also, a great dessert menu! You must get the Bufala Verace pizza. It is by far the best kind.

DREADFUL SERVICE! we went here since there were 454 reviews on yelp with avg of 4.5 stars. although the food was excellent (mediterranean bruschetta; gamberi rucola pizza), alyssa, our waitress, was missing in action the entire evening: we waited quite a while for her to show up at all; my cocktail came after our bruschetta; the pizza came but we had no silverware and had to ask a busboy to help us out; after we finished our pizza, wanting to order coffee and dessert, alyssa once again had to be summoned by someone else's waiter whom we recruited for the mission. we gave up and just left. it ruins dinner when you have to ride herd on your wait-staff! (in fairness to Pomo, it seems to be an Alyssa problem since the waiters on either side of us were quite attentive to their tables.)

Went for lunch with the family.   Excellent meal!  Service was fast, friendly.  Their dough is probably the tastiest I've had in phoenix.  I enjoyed their pizzas better than both bianco and Cibo.  I look forward to returning soon!

This place was AWESOME!  We came on a Friday during primetime, but we were able to snag two seats at the bar.  The bartender was incredibly helpful, friendly, and really passionate about working at this restaurant!  The pizza was absolutely amazing, and I seriously wish that I lived in Phoenix so I could eat it every day.  Not only was the bartender great, but (as mentioned in other reviews) the chef provided us with TWO rounds of complimentary fried dough and limoncella. I've run out of superlatives but this place is legit.  If you live or are visiting Phoenix, I would strongly recommend you go out of your way to eat at Pomo Pizzeria!

Stumbled onto Pomo Pizzeria by accident late on a Saturday night and was more than pleasantly surprised.  I was very impressed with their food and attentive wait staff. After having lived in Chicago for 15 years, I'm hesitant to compare pizza/pasta against restaurants back "home", but Pomo was excellent and I'd highly recommend it.  Prices were fair and we really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. I will continue to go back.
Pizza is delicious here!  Great decor, wonderful service.  Closest to authentic Italian you can get in Phoenix!  Always a treat to come here.  The Margherita pizza is my absolute fav!!!!

Went here for a girls lunch with my mom and sister, and it was great! Very cool atmosphere and friendly staff. We split two of the salads, both very fresh with unique ingredients. We also shared their margharita pizza...Great! we left nothing but crumbs.

Probably the best pizza that I have ever had. I keep it simple, a bit of cheese, sauce, and some olives.  This place is legit!  Cool atmosphere, great owner.   Remember, good food takes a minute so do not expect to get your meal fast. It takes time to make it fresh and cook it the way you are supposed to.  It is pricey but worth it. Come one man, this aint Pizza Hut!!!  Go try this place and you will thank me!

Damn son. As a Chicago resident, I thought I had eaten all the great pizza I would consume. I was visiting Phoenix and this place was just down the street, so we figured, when in Rome ...   We ordered a pizza, flatbread and salad, all of which were amazing. The crust of the bread and pizza were delightfully charred, but still chewy on the inside. All the ingredients were top-notch and the salad was perfectly dressed.   The complimentary fried dough and creamy limoncello were just the cherry on top of an awesome night of dining al fresco.
Really good pizza, awesome atmosphere and an open kitchen. Def authentic as far as crust, toppings and style, bit a little pricey. Will be back nonetheless.

I eat here at least once a week. I am lucky to work nearby. But, this place is so good that I often take guests there or find myself eating there on weekends. You will not be disappointed. The service can be a bit slow sometimes and they seem to have a lot of turnover among waitstaff, but the food is outstanding. The coffee too!

Wow! This might be the best Neopolitan pizza I have outside of Italy. We tried 4 different pizzas and all were outstanding. All ingredients were authentic and extremely fresh. Crust was absolutely perfect. The decor and service was also excellent. I will definitely return the next time I am in Phoenix.
This place is absolutely amazing. From the authentic Italian food to the home made lemoncello, it's my favorite place in Phoenix. Just do it. No joke, just do it

Four person rundown:  Grilled Veggies - lightly grilled veggies served with a side of seasoned olive oil. Very light and very well done  Caprese - fresh and light. Worth a try  Mango Salad - Citrus meets tart. Topped with creamy balsamic vinegar.   Shrimp Salad - A good bit of shrimp and a very nice dressing  Toto Sapore (meat pizza) - delectably crisp with just the right amount of toppings  Wonderful service and just an all around good experience. Will repeat.

Great place- kind of a cool vibe and great food.  If there were half stars, I would give this a 4.5, but definitely leaning toward 5 rather than just 4.  Ordered the Bufala Verace and the Principe pizzas, which were both phenomenally tasty.  Definitely recommended.
Excellent pizza. The evening we where there, the owner gave every table a free sweet treat and shots to end the meal. Nice touch!

Prego!  If you want pizza, get it here! The Verace pizza arrived hot, a little too burnt-to-a-crisp, but still palatable. We also ordered the pollo salad (pronounced "polo" not my embarrassingly "po-yo") to make sure we had our daily dose of veggies. We decided to forego on dessert, but our server brought out a complimentary plate of fried dough strips with powdered sugar.   Parking was easy, we were surprised by the no-wait on a Saturday night.  A good casual dinner pick!  .

All you need to know - very good pizza.  And they care about it; you can tell good food is personally important to management and employees.  It was interesting to learn they are part of an international society that supports and evaluates pizzerias around the world.    Servie is always excellent.  Good wine selection, and they give you a chance to taste before you buy.  Can't imagine why anyone would wait in line to go to Bianco when you can walk in to Pomo and experience wine and food that is as good or better.

Great place! Came here with a group of coworkers, David was our server and he was very helpful. It was our first time going and he was very knowledgeable, we told him what we felt like and he gave us great unbiased opinions. We ordered 6 different pizzas, only finished 5. They were all delicious. We also ordered a bread basket, meat plate appetizer  and 2 desserts to share between us. The food was phenomenal, service was the best I've had and I definitely will return. The general manager came by towards the end of our visit and offered us a round of HOMEMADE limon cello (on the house) and it was delicious. If you love Italian food and great service, this is the place to be. I couldn't be more pleased with my experience.

Love this place! Having traveled to Italy and having such a wonderful experience there, I love coming to this place for a nostalgic experience with my husband. It truly is simple foods, done very well. The atmosphere is very laid-back, but also feels special at the same time.

Who knew Phoenix was turning into the place to get good pizza?? There are so many great spots downtown including the notorious pizzaria bianco but Pomo is also pretty good if you don't want to wait hours for your pizza.  The pizzas are thin and get soft from the sauce so they are a little hard to eat. You've got to master the pizza fold.  We had the burrata as an appetizer and it was delicious.  I have no idea where people park, though. It's tucked away on a side street. We walked from cityscape.
Yummmmmmmm! Buffala pizza = bomb.com. The owner brings you this flaky desert and a shot of limoncello. Oh yeah, doesn't get any better.

Back in the day I went to the location on Scottsdale a couple of times and I loved it so I paid a visit to the DT Phoenix location and I believe it's even better.  Great decoration, wonderful staff, knowledgeable and kind waitresses (Kiera was super kind) and really good food.  The caprese salad was superb, hands down.  I also had the Pomo pizza which was very good.  The chef (I believe he's the owner) is super kind and he stopped by our table to greet and invite my friend and I a shot of a liquor that was pretty tasty and also shared some kind of desert which was also pretty good.  A funny fact is that all the floor staff were women (beautiful and super kind women).  BTW the bar looks pretty cool as well, could be a good place for a happy hour for two.  I'll be back soon.  Cheers

I'm giving this place 5 stars as I have given Bianco and Cibo.   Excellent pizza that nestles itself nicely between the crusts of Bianco and Cibo.  Bianco = paper thin, irregular shaped pies with crunchy (no doughy) crust that's a little burned in a spot with or two with big bubbles and fantastically fresh ingredients  Cibo = crust about as thick as two nickles with the outside wonderfully flavored and small "bubbles" and chewy and fantastically fresh ingredients  Pomo = nickle thick bottom with outside crust right smack in the middle between the above two. Medium bubbles here. Again.. fantastically fresh ingredients. Their slices of pepperoni are thicker but smaller around than the other two  Really just depends on your mood that day. Reasonably priced like the rest and awesome pie.

Went for a business dinner and was a bit loud. Awesome owner who was present. He is from Italy and at the end of your meal provides lemon chello, the real kind and fried dough. Good was great but not great for business meals.

Great food, kickback atmosphere, and very down to earth employees.  Pizza comes in one size accompanied with fresh ingredients and a shot of lemon cello with fried flour covered with powdered sugar and honey after every meal.   If you haven't been, it is a must!

Pomo is awesome. Much better value than pizzeria bianco with a larger menu and bar options. I like the atmosphere better here than bianco as well. Our server was attentive and recommended us a fantastic bottle of wine paired with two pizzas we got - and this was at a birthday dinner with 20+ guests at one table. Great experience, I can't wait to go back!

I just went to a few cities in Italy Aug 2013, and fell in love with the pizza in Naples and Rome. Naples, known as the city where pizza originated from, has am-azing pizza. The sauce is simple, the dough is fresh, soft, and really delicious.   Although Pomo has more ingredients on the pizza, such as arugula or sausage if you want, the dough is perfect. It really brought me back to the pizza I had in Naples. There seems to be a lot of pizza places in Phoenix and Scottsdale, and even a Grimaldi's opened in Scottsdale.   We had just had Pizza Bianco the day before, and Pomo is wayyyyyyy better. It's probably the best pizza place I've had in the states so far that serves napoletana pizza.   This was my most memorable meal next to Nobuo's in Phoenix. And for that, THANK YOU, Arizona!!

No ambience at this place at all. Weather was chilly tonight so my boyfriend and I opted to sit inside..There were a few larger tables for groups and then a long wall booth with smaller tables and chairs in front of it. It was like being in a cafeteria ..we were wedged in between two other couples. UGH. wanted a quiet relaxing dinner and that didn't happen. The waiter was rude and fake. He kept hitting on two girl customers..kind of creepy. Also a worker hit me with the door..when he apologized he REEKED of alcohol. The food was the same as the service. Awful. My pizza came out and it was so soggy the toppings all slid right off. It was a disgusting mushy mess. The chicken on my salad was dry and tasted of very poor quality. I feel like I must have went on an off or bad night because I am not picky and there are so many good reviews for this place......I however, couldn't wait to leave so I surely will never go back. Bummer.

Ate here last weekend with my boyfriend and another couple, and we were all very impressed with the quality of food. My boyfriend and I split the margherita pizza and a shrimp and arugula pizza, while our friends split a salad and a pizza with a lot of meat toppings.   The pizza at Pomo is made in the Neapolitan tradition (one of only two pizzerias in Arizona that are certified to do so), so it's crispy on the crust, and soft on the inside. This was especially true of the margherita, which had dough so soft in the middle that paired nicely with the creaminess of the mozarella.   The shrimp and arugula pizza might have been my favorite, however. The dough wasn't quite as soft as the margherita, and the shrimp's flavor was brought out by the arugula.   I had a glass of pinot grigio, which was a little sweeter than my liking, and the rest of the table had beer that was on special -- $2 for watermelon beer! I definitely would recommend ordering some if they still have it, as it was a nice summery treat.   Before we left, one of the owners came by with a shot of this creamy, cinnamon-flavored Everclear, and a plate of fried dough topped with powdered sugar and Nutella. Although this seems to be his schtick with all the diners, it was a sweet and appreciated gesture, not to mention tasty! We had to hang out at the restaurant after drinking the shots because they were a little on the strong side, but so delicious.  The only reason I've docked a star was due to our service. Our server was too attentive -- every couple of minutes she was over to ask how food was/to see if we needed anything, and then when we would tell her we were fine, she would just stand there. Staring at us. For like a minute. So totally bizarre.

This place is just about perfect. The staff is friendly and attentive.  The pizza my wife and I had was thin and crispy. We were kinda hungry so we ordered another and it was the same. The complimentary limoncello and fried dough with powdered sugar was really nice of the owner. We will be eating here again on our next trip to Phoenix.

I loved this place. The chief made top quality ingredients  into perfection. The pizza is made within minutes from the moment you order it. Pepper oil that is served with every dish adds a touch to already culinary masterpiece.

Have seen this place for a few weeks but decided to finally try it out for girls night. Went with my two girlfriends! Ordered a bottle of wine and three desserts. The cannolis, tiramisu and crem br√ªl√©e. Mmm. Perfect desserts. My roommate swears by the tiramisu.   The atmosphere was fantastic. The waitress was so great! She actually convinced us to come back just to try their sandwiches. They let us stay past closing as we finished our bottle of wine and were very accommodating!
I loved the thin crust . The menu for pizza is very extensive and very Italian. The pizza sauce was spicy and fantastic as well. Had a couple cocktails and they were well made and service was great.

Great pizza, but there are no pastas or gluten free options at this location. The scottsdale location has a bigger menu and I was hoping for pasta. I would give them 5 stars if I was just after pizza but due to the lack of pastas I have to deduct a star.

Th great pizzeria on any street corner. The  crust was cooked to perfection. I had the Contondina: onions the food was exceptional it brought back memories of my past life when i could find a good pizza on the east coast.  The complimentary lemonchello was to die for.
Yum-my everything from start to finish. Staff helpfull & attentive. Can't wait to go back & get some more pizza, caonnli & limoncello.

The best pizza in the valley. I love the fast service, friendly atmosphere and most importantly the food.  Whenever the family gets together for dinner this is our go to place.  I admit, one tiny drawback, is to make sure you have money for parking.  That aside you won't be disappointed in your experience here.  Especially since your meal concludes with free limoncello and free powered sugar fried dust bread.  DELICIOUS!!!

Great food and service in Downtown Phoenix. I decided to play it safe and ordered the Margarita pizza and it is one of the best that I've had to date. I did ask for extra basil after so I'll be sure to do that next time. Perfectly sized meal, great atmosphere, I will be back.

Holy Cannoli-this place deserves 10 stars!! A friend of mine and I were out and about for the ski pro Avalanche sale at the convention center. After waiting in line for approximately 6 days we checked out and were ravenous! We decided to go here based on a recommendation from someone in line ahead of us. This place does not disappoint. We ordered the chicken salad but subbed the homemade dressing for the lemon vinaigrette. It was a good helping of spring mix, pine nuts, tomatoes and AVOCADO!!! Bomb.com, people!!!   Next we ordered the pizza with all the meat (can't recall the name of it..toto something or other)! The crust was the perfect blend of crispy and chewy. It was perfection!!   As a complete surprise, after our meal a nice gentleman came up and offered us a shot of their homemade limoncello! You MUST try it. One word: delicious.     I highly recommend this place!!  Price: salad, pizza and one diet coke came out to around $30 pre-tax/tip. And ya know what??? Worth every penny!!

We have been coming down to Phoenix from Alaska for many years and have been searching for "that pizza place". We have finally found it.  Everything on the menu was fantastic. To top it off we had excellent service from David (we sat and ate at the bar). The owner shared a little something from the old country at the end of the meal. This is THE ONLY  pizza place we will go to from now on when we visit Phoenix.

New to the state, last week I decided to try some of the popular restaurants in the downtown area. I had one of the worst experiences, let me share a bit of my night .  There were some art shows and presentations down Roosevelt Street, I believe it is called "First Friday". Walked past a cute little building and saw it was Pomo and remembered that was on my list for places to try out. We get there and it is relatively busy as I would expect on a Friday night, the hostess was nice and very kindly cleaned a table for us to sit in. It took about 10 minutes plus for someone to bring us water. Then she finally came back and seemed extremely stressed (not to mention this was the first time I have ever seen a waitress wear a mini jean skirt and an apron) I was very shocked they allowed her to wear that as everyone else was wearing black jeans or work pants. We had been sitting there for over 20 minutes and were very ready for some food. I ordered a glass of wine and a pizza Margherita. The pizza came out within 5 min yet my glass still never arrived. A tall man who seemed to be the manager walked by us looked at the table, didn't greet us nor notice we had no extra plates or silverware on the table. I had to wave down the hostess and she kindly brought us the silverware and some oils and pepper flakes.  I was nearly done with my meal when the waitress finally returned to checked back up on us. I told her my wine never arriving and she just gave me a strange look, I believe she just never put it in. After reminding her about my glass she still didn't offer to get me the drink. I was very annoyed but trying to keep my calm, it was noticeable english wasn't her first language but I don't think I was too difficult to understand my order.  After that she started coming to check on us a bit more often since she noticed I wasn't in a very good mood. A big table beside us had just left and I noticed she did not help pick up a single cup both times she went out there. The hostess cleared the whole table, seemed like that young girl and the kitchen were the only ones working.  This isn't even the worst part yet. I went into the ladies room and there is a horrible oder, seem like someone couldn't hold it and pooped on the ground. The worst part is that it looked like someone tried to just clean it with paper towels instead of giving it a proper clean. I could not finish my business, I quickly left and told my husband to pay in cash so we could just get out of this place as quickly as possible. I hate not leaving a proper tip but I do not believe she even earned any of what we did leave her.   I was extremely disappointed with my experience, the food was very good, saddly I can't actually leave a rating based on just that.
The pizza was excellent as well as the staff. David, one of the waiters was awesome so friendly and willing to get us anything that we needed.

This place is absolutely amazing. From the service to the food. Everything tastes so fresh. We ordered the POMO pizza and also the waitress recommended the mushroom soup. Paula was such a fun helpful happy spirited woman who helped us on our first time experience. Thanks POMO. I'll be back again!

Taste like Italy! I really loved this little low key pizza join. My hubby and I stopped in tonight for a quick bite. They don't take reservations but we were able to be seated right away. Peroni on tap was a plus. :) We started with the caprese and split the peppino pizza. I highly recommend the peppino!! A little sausage ricotta perfection! :) Most of the other guest ordered one pizza per person but one was enough for us. My hubby could have ordered more so if your hungry you might want you own pie. After dinner the offered some complimentary limoncello. It tasted like sweet lemon candy! Sooo good! Try this place out! It's great!

This is the "cheese pizza". I thought commodity prices where heading down? Apparently not, these folks are rationing the mozzarella! Maybe next time I will the order the extra extra extra extra cheese. Make it look and taste like a pizza guy, not a big bread stick with tomato sauce.

Honestly the best pizza I have ever had!!!!   My boyfriend said its the best pizza he's had since being in the US since 2013!!!  Everything is fresh. Fire wood stone oven!!!  Perfect crust!!   We also had tiramisu!  It is also home made. So amazing and moist.  The best I've ever had for sure.   The owner came out with a complementary desert while we waited for our tiramisu and also poured all 3 of us a shot of liminchello!!!   It was amazing!!   We needed to be rolled out of there. But omg!!!  It was soooo worth it!!!
The most amazing pizza in Phoenix. Owner and the entire staff are a delight to chat with. When I want the best, a quick trip from Mesa is worth it every time.

Hands down, best pizza in Phoenix.  We've tried several of the eateries around town, becoming regulars at Federal and Parlor. But it's not even in the same league.  It's been a long time since I had a high quality piece of Italian pie. Throw in the fact that cannolis are on the dessert menu and my craving for pizza Saturday night was sky high. Not far from our house, we figured we better try it now before we move.  We arrive on a decent weather night around 6:30. The place is packed. 45 minute wait for a table, or sit now at the bar. We opt for the bar as it's just the two of us and we are hungry.  Start with caprese (so delicious and the mozz is amazing). Yum. Two pizzas. Husband demolishes his. I finish half because, ahem, I want cannoli. Both amazing. Well, mine was great (Margherita), I never got a chance to try husbands.  OMG, the cannoli. I haven't had cannoli since Sicily in 2009. I was SO FREAKING HAPPY. I want them now. I want them all the time. Knowing that I can get cannoli like that here in Phoenix is dangerous knowledge.  We've got about 3 weeks before we leave Phoenix. We'll be back.

First time here. NOT impressed. First I will say the ingredients seemed good and the food tasted amazing for what we ordered. But here's what we had to endure to get it. We made reservation online because we happen to see the option. Got there...no reservations. They weren't busy so no big deal. We sit down among other families and within a few minutes the music changes to hard core hand banger hard rock. Then another song...same thing. We look at the surrounding of old Hollywood photos and say to each other...are we missing something? We tell the waitress...who then sends a manger (I'm assuming because he didn't identify himself). Both not opting to change the obviously obnoxious music but ask us if we like it? Really???? He wasn't getting it and we had to give him the analogy of "outside of a tattoo shop, where is this music ever appropriate???  Of course he doesn't answer that and hardly looks at me anymore trying to convince us this is appropriate...but he wants to make us happy (at this point coming across patronizing). It gets changed with the statement they are catering to a young downtown crowd. Food comes. Tastes great but pizza is the soggiest thin crust pizza I've ever had. Was surrounded by fruit flies while we ate (no bug light anywhere of course). If you've seen any of the bar rescue shows you know if there are fruit flies flying around customers...they are also flying around and most likely floating at the bottom of the alcohol bottles. We don't know for sure and I certainly wasn't about to ask the long haired bartender to check. To add to our amazing experience we are sitting along a full length padded bench...of which our section is the only one not all torn up. Chairs are all nicked and worn. To a young downtown crowd these may not be a concern...clearly. But to the rest of us we expect a bit more.

Great vibe in this place. Very friendly staff. Outside area had plenty of heaters so it was comfortable even on a chillier night. As for the food, it definitely brought me back to a little piece of Italy. We have the Bufalo pizza and caprese salad. Both great. 3 people had two pizzas, caprese and three drinks got out for $60. Plenty of food. Highly recommend.

Awesome service and one of the best pizzas I have ever tried! Place also has a really good vibe to it, I got pizza to go this time but I really look forward to coming here with some friends for a pizza and a couple beers. I will be back!
Great tasting pizza, awesome dessert made with Nutella, just wish they had Moscato. People that work there are very attentive and do a great job serving.

Tried this place for the 1st time and loved it!  The neapolitan pizza is excellent and service is great.  We sat on the beautiful patio outside as the weather was nice, really enjoyable.  Some really good Italian wines and decent craft beer selection.  Oh, and loved the free homemade limoncello as a tasty after dinner treat, to die for!  Will be coming back!

This is the best pizzeria in phoenix they cook brick oven pizza taste just like nyc Grimaldi's!  I love the atmosphere outdoor and indoor dining along with a quiet bar area. They serve the food fast. I would recommend this place to everyone.

If you are looking for the best and most authentic pizza in phoenix, look no further. I have been here three times and every time they seem to raise the bar. The Pizza is amazing, authentic ingredients, and authentic tastes. The atmosphere is also good as it is easy to be comfortable and relaxed here especially with guests. The decor is Italian, the waiters speak Italian, and the alcohol is Italian. Try the tiramisu it will blow your mind.

We came to Phoenix last week for a wedding so we had a party of maybe 20 people. Service was spot on and attentive, and the pizzas were just amazing. I haven't tasted pizza like that in a long time. The sweet marinara and salty mozzarella was just simply perfect. I would come here all the time if I lived here.

Awesome, fresh neapolitan Pizzas. I also really enjoyed the antipasti grilled vegetables with an incredible olive oil based dipping sauce. Good selection of pizzas.  The servers were very friendly and attentive. The owner came out at the end and offered us homemade Limoncello shots.  Highly recommended.

I love this place. There, I said it. Right at the very start of my review! I love Pomo Pizzeria for its DELICIOUS food. I love it for its location right there on 1st St in downtown Phoenix (although other locations are available for those of you in Glendale, Scottsdale, or Gilbert!). And I love it for its consistently outstanding service.  I've been to Pomo Pizzeria many times, but will never forget my first visit ever. It was as if the owner could sniff out a newbie! Honestly, the quality personal engagement of the total team there was (and has continued to be) truly outstanding.  I was introduced to Pomo by one of my very closest friends, who "dragged" me along because she was THAT excited to have me experience the high level of service and delicious food she had come to expect from this location.
