Very dope restaurant. This pizza was absolutely amazing. I got the margherita and it was pretty life changing. I also had the romana salad and it might be the best salad I ever ate. The cheese and croutons are so fresh.  I loved the italian sodas.   The mallofogie(sp) was probably the best dessert I ever had.  The staff was very friendly and provided great service and recommendations.  Everything about this place oozes authenticity, from all of the italian the staff was speakign to the little scooters out front to the compliementary powdered dough with sugar and limoncellos after the meal.  If this isn't the best pizza in AZ, its right behind pizzicletta.. but it is definitely above Cibo and Bianco in my books.

While in Phoenix make a trip to Pomo! I came to Pomo while spending a night in town for work.  I sat at the bar and conveniently found out that on Tuesday nights they do half price bottles of wine.  Of course I went with one - the Super Tuscan.  I hope the next time I'm back it is a Tuesday.  On to food - I went with the Principe pizza on David the bartender's suggestion.  Great choice.  The pizza is absolutely fantastic and I am a tough judge since we have excellent pizza in NY.  They use fresh, imported ingredients.  The oven and most of the ingredients are straight from Italy.  I also got the Mista salad which is huge and very fresh. At the end of my meal the owner handed some delicious homemade limoncello - some of the best I've had.  Also got a taste of dessert.  Overall great food and atmosphere.  I'll be back when I'm back in Phoenix.
Genuine stuff with so many unique options. Love they offer calzone.  Spicy olive oil a hit. Good for business or pleasure.

I was a roly-poly ball of hunger fueled mania when I came here this evening, so I'm not sure if that's what's talking here or not -- all I know is that I think I had one of the best dinners of the year here.  We split a pizza and the summer sausage pasta. I know there are names for these, but I will have to look them up and edit this review after I awaken from my food-coma.  The service was pretty great. The waitress at first was quite slow to take our order, but the owner seemed to have noticed this and immediately stepped in to take care of us. After this, service was attentive and friendly -- we wanted for not a thing.

Met some friends for dinner on Saturday night.  Was great!  Food was terrific, service was casual (fitting for the atmosphere) and fun.  Staff was responsive to all our needs.  Had 3 pizzas (all great).  Beer (waitress brought me 2 samples to help me choose) and wine.  All a+.

Fantastic food, atmosphere, and staff. We had amazing service through our entire visit and the food and drinks were wonderful. A great place to visit for date night before heading over to FilmBar to catch a flick.

Dear Lord, will you please put a Pomo in downtown Seattle? We stopped here last Sunday, was our last meal before leaving Phoenix and man am I glad it was this place.  The service was impeccable, the food and craft cocktails were mouth watering (had the lasagna & a pizza) and brag worthy.  Then at the end they brought us a wonderfully crafted shot of Lemoncello which was so delicate and a perfect way to end the evening.  This place was tip top!
Best dough, cheese, meats outside of Naples, Italy.  This is by FAR the most authentic Neapolitan pizza in the Valley.  When I take my last breath I want it to be chewing on their pizza dough.

I think it is good, but not quite the hype. Also, service seems to be OK.  When you are in a trendy, down town environment, you need to stand out.  Pomo fades into the crowd for me.  Good but not great.  I would eat here again, but I may not go out of the way to find it.  Could have just been an off day.

Big pizza fan here so whenever I go out of town, I always look for a good pizza spot.   What separates a good pie from a great pie comes down to the sauce imho. The sauce was on point and the crust was crispy.  I also had some brushetta which I loved.  The only small deduction would be the person who put the toppings on the pizza. It was thrown on haphazardly with 1/2 the pizza having all the meat and the other half having veggies. Some slices seemed to be vegetarian and others triple meat. Didn't make for a great presentation. Still good food though.

Oh my word.  This pizza takes me back to Italy.  We've searched high and low over the states for authentic Italian pizza and we finally found it with Pomo.  Especially in a city that is a pizza lover's paradise...we LOVE Pomo!  We've eaten at both locations and prefer the quaintness of the downtown location.  It too takes me back to Italy.  And the owners speak Italian which makes the whole experience very fun with the word 'prego' being thrown around quite a bit.  Makes me smile.  This is my kid's favorite place as well (ages 2, 5 and 7).

This is a cute little Italian joint. My friend and I went at 645 and it was busy but we barely had to wait 10 minutes and they suggested that we stop in at the turf for a drunk first(the bar next door). It was nice in there but a lot of green lighting, which doesn't really make anyone look good. We got our table and sat outside. The service was quick but not very careful. At first when our pizza came out, there were no plates, napkins or the toppings they are supposed to bring  with it. We asked for those things and the napkins didn't show up until we were almost finished.  The pizza was delicious, we got the one that starts with an a, I don't recall the exact name. I would defiantly eat here again.   One other thing was we both ordered a glass of the White House wine and it tasted like what I imagine pee tastes like. It was pretty gross, I'd suggest you splurge a little and go for a more expensive wine, you will probably have better luck.

Ate at Pomo last night for the first time and was thoroughly impressed! The Margherita Pizza was out of this world! I lived in Italy for awhile and have to say this was the closest I've had since my return. When compared to true Italian pizza, this was far closer and better than even Pizzeria Bianco. The service was good too. I will most definitely be back...very soon!!

HORRIBLE, horrible, horrible service! I visited on Saturday 5/16 at 6 pm. Hostess says we've got a 30 min wait, we'll call you. After 45 mins later and no call our group of 4 returned to check in. Hostess says "hey we phoned you." I call BS as my mobile has phone history and tracks calls, and there was no calls for 2 hrs. She says my list and notes say we phoned. "I say the technology says otherwise. You're either calling me a liar or there's a mistake" She didn't even try to place us elsewhere. We requested to speak with the manager. She refused to call the manager over. Saying one was no one on duty. Wow! Then she ignored us at the reception podium for another 5 mins to wait us out. We gave up when no more action was happening from the service side of Pomo. There's too many good pizza joints in downtown Phoenix to put up with this. Pomo will see us No Mo!

The foot was great! I don't remember what it was called but I had their version of a meat lovers pizza and my date had the margarita pizza. We both ate the entire pizza because even after you're full, you just can't stop eating because it is so good. After our meal, our waiter brought out complimentary dessert and they gave us shots. I couldn't hear what he said the drink was but it was thick and sweet but that was a nice touch to close out the experience. I just found out there is one in Gilbert which makes me very excited so I can have this place more often!

This place was fantastic. The only reason I didn't give it 5 Stars is because I didn't try everything on the menu! (but I would've liked to) I was in Phoenix for work, and found this place after arriving at the airport. Very friendly staff! Looking for the next reason to come back here!

I am very picky with my pizza, and this place has the best pizza by far!! It is thin, Neapolitan style pizza - so although a whole pizza to yourself may seem like a ton of food, it is actually not heavy or overly filling. Or, a nice lunch would be to split a salad and a pizza between a few people. The ingredients are authentic and Italian, and I love that the menu describes the items using italian words. It just ups the authenticity and makes it fun to try new things. I went there with my family of 6 and our food came out very quickly. Our server was great at answering our questions and was very good at prebussing (clearing the table of unnecessary plates, cups, flatware). She also made a point of just giving us time hang out and enjoy our company while not rushing to hand us the bill. The owner?/manager? came over and gave us free sangrias during the meal, and dessert/after dinner drinks on the house!  The hospitality here was truly amazing. I've worked in the restaurant industry for over 8 years now, and it is very obvious that the staff here is trained well and enjoys their work. Put that together with the amazing food and Pomo is the place to go!!

Go here as soon as you land in Phoenix! The Pizza tastes like its right off the streets in Italy and it should because the owner seems to be right off the streets of Italy. The complimentary Limoncello tastes like chilled cake icing in a cup! The Peroni was ice cold. The bruschetta was so fresh! I had the Diavola pizza. I soaked it in their chili infused olive oil. I'm telling you it was the best pizza I've had west of the Atlantic!
There's a reason why the Neapolitans are the godfathers of pizza; come to Pomo and discover why.

Delicious wine. Divine pizza. Depictions of Italian street life on wall murals. And a surprise treat at the end of the meal. This place offered up a great dinner experience a deux for hubby and I.  The Margherita pizza was simple...and simply delicious. We shared one pie and a salad, and then a slice of the Hazelnut Torte cake. Yummmm. The waitress was knowledgeable about the wine list and suggested two reds that we also really liked.  After our meal, the chef brought us a special (and unexpected) treat...homemade limoncello shots and powdered sugar-coated crispy dessert bites.  After a meal like this, the only thing I was left craving was a spin on a Vespa!

Went with a group of five this evening and we were very disappointed!  one of the guy was very nice to turn the second heat on when we were sitting outside. I asked for a second coke bc the 1st one had been sitting out for long time i think, there was no bubble and tasteless. Our main waiter was nice doing it without question asked. However, seriously, my coke was still almost the same.  Took a long time for the food ready, and almost everything was very salty which all of us even my niece 10 years old agreed with. We had the bread brought out after our main food. Its ridiculous. Isn't that necessary or matter anymore.  I feel bad to tell all of these things here instead of confronting straight to our waiter. It would be pointless i think and too many things to say.  After all, we were wondering how this place got 4.5 stars with great pictures of food. We shouldnot trust yelp anymore.  The chicken salad looked so great in the picture but its dry and weird. We spent $100 for bad food and ending up we went home find something better to eat.  I felt so bad bc i am the one who chose this location for my friends, they weren't happy at all. We were just unfortunate maybe!

My AAU  basketball girls were basically "Shooshed" by the waiter Stan, before we even got situated in the already loud restaurant. Then, Stan complained because we needed 4 separate checks for 14 people. Lastly, he called out drink-types 1 by 1 and told everyone to "raise your hand" instead of addressing each diner individually. I asked him if perhaps another waiter, more accustomed  to dealing with large groups would be better.  Of course he is still severing us, so the end result will remain to be seen.  So far, 10mins later and we are just now getting drinks, which he can not remember who-ordered-what & we are missing one drink. Stan has apologized for the "misunderstanding," which we have accepted. I believe you can do better Stan & Pomo.  Part2 to come........Spoke w/manager (Fransisco?) who was very understanding and open to constructive criticism. Admitted to Stan being a new employee and needing more staff. In the end, the Pizza was good.
The pizza is the best we have eaten. There was no wait. We got our food in 10min. Great friendly service. Enjoyed!
The food is fantastic and the staff is super friendly. You can tell the panini bread and pizza dough are actually made in house.

What a disappointment! My boyfriend and I visited because we are new to Phoenix, live downtown and this place had excellent reviews. It is WAY overrated.   I was handed a dirty, torn menu right off the bat (it even had summer specials even though it was fall). That is enough indication of the amount of care put into a restaurant. We then had to ask for a waitress when no one attended us in a reasonable amount of time. When she came by, she was not in the least bit welcoming. We ordered drinks hoping it was just a fluke. Nope...the poor attitude continued when our orders arrive and we were asked what we wanted to order. We decided against eating here, paid for our drinks and headed to the Chamber's next door - where we had an amazing time. Pomo's was such a waste of time.
Had communication from Pomo to clear up a misunderstanding on the part of the host who took my call. Would try them again... :)

Service: Our first experience, without going into detail, started off VERY rough. The owner was notified and he more than compensated us. I have never experienced any company going so out of their way to correct a huge mistake. No one is perfect, mistakes happen, but it's how those mistakes are handled that counts. We went back the next weekend.   Food: Best Neapolitan pizza in the valley. The real deal tomatoes. We used to drive all the way to downtown Glendale to go to another famous pizza place (the only other one in the valley area with certified tomatoes besides this one) and this place blows them out of the water. Fresh, delicious. Get the margherita. Tiramisu was fantastic and I don't even like deserts.

When I travel I look for authentic Neapolitan pizza since my hometown has none. This place did not disappoint! I was dining with three men. I was the only one to finish my entire pizza, crusts and all! They even have several Italian beers, including my fave: Peroni! Bravo Pomo!
We stop in at least once when we come to Phoenix. The ambience is cool. Food is always good.
I went here and had a Toto Sapore. Amazing! I've been going to this place even more now - great service!
Fresh food is to word here. Friendly staff. The Caprese is a great way to start. Then an awesome Pizza.
Wow, definitely some of the best pizza in the valley! Tuesdays are 1/2 priced bottles of wine. Make sure to try the traditional pizzas!

Can't say enough good about this place. Came upon it on a two day trip and ended up there twice in two days. Best pizza I've ever eaten. Personally I think it had a lot to do with the sauce and crust. Also the mulo was a great drink they made my wife ordered both nights. The service was phenomenal. I didn't get the name of the gentleman at the bar who served us the second night but he was a great guy. Complimentary shots of lemoncello. Even though we came in just before close he made sure to let us know there was no rush and to enjoy ourselves.   In my opinion this is a must visit for anyone visiting Phoenix.

I haven't even finished eating and I have to give them a 5 stars! Me being Italian definitely makes my review bias but damn: they got it! The romana salad was nice and simple but yet delightful, Bufala pizza was to die for and Tiramisu was as good as mine! Good job guys!

Loved the interior. it was clean and inviting (a big plus was the nice booth seating options). I dug the street scene mural as well. Pomo also has a cute bar,  and equally cute " al fresco" dining area . They use really select fresh imported ingredients,  and cook the pizza in one helluva oven (950 degrees). The meat and cheese plate paired with some great olives was delicious as was my mushroom soup.  Our table ordered 2 pies (sausage,mushroom,onion,peppers)(zucchini,peppers,¬≠egplant)  The pizza was simply outstanding, i allowed myself a slice ..and it was a slice of heaven Grilled zucchini,roasted red peppers ,eggplant. The presentation, aroma,  and taste was wonderful, the crust perfect !....This is PIZZA ..Italian pizza ! We all really enjoyed this pizza and cannot wait to try more from the menu.  A nod to the pastry chef ..for the fabu chocolate molten cake ( with gelato) Cannoli, and fig custard ..oh and the amaretto cookies .  Service was terrific! solid menu!  pure authentic ingredients,  and certified napoletana pizza = 5 solid stars!

Oh my my! You must eat here! I have been in Phoenix 18 months and this is my first "must" review. My advice is share the salad, share the pizza, but eat the whole dessert yourself! Authentic food, great service, excellent experience.

This review is long overdue. I found out about Pomo pizzeria a few years ago and it is literally the best pizza I have ever had....and I've had a lot of pizza. I have been to this location as well as the Gilbert location and both have been great experiences. My favorite pizza is the Toto Sapore and I also love the Peppino. I have also tried the lasagna and another pasta dish and both of them were incredibly fresh and tasty. One of the best parts about this restaurant is the ambiance and the owner. The shot of homemade limoncello at the end is seriously the best way to end the meal. I don't think I will ever be able to find a better pizzeria than Pomo.

This is one of these fine dining restaurants that located at the downtown area. Also a fine place to go for weekend leisure. If you are craving for quality Italian food this is the place to go. The server came couple times to check on everything and even helped us box our left over.

Went here for 6p, light dinner on a Saturday: Had just the margherita pizza - really fabulous! Hubs usually doesn't like thin crust, but he really liked the crust, and all the ingredients were balanced.  One star taken away: really should be 5 stars, but perhaps our waiter was new? Maybe it was his first job? We still had 3 pieces left of our pizza to finish and he asked "so are we thinking of getting dessert?" It was premature to ask and hubs and I looked at each other quizzically. We said "no thank you." I added "we're still working on the pieces we have."   Then there was 1 more piece of pizza left and he asked "anything else I can get you?" It was kind of him to ask. We said no thanks and he gave us the check right away. Felt like he was rushing to get us out...however there were about 5 tables occupied inside at the time and lots of other empty tables. By the time the pizza got to our table, and by the time we got up to leave, it was 20-25 mins.   Net-net, I felt rushed. I didn't take offense and maybe he was new to his job. But please don't rush customers about dessert when they aren't done with their main meal.   Extras: they provided a lightly peppered olive oil, parmesan, chili flakes and Italian seasoning on the side. This was definitely the piece that stood out!

My girlfriend and I attended Pomo's last month and we were extremely happy with the service and the food.   We were really shocked on how fast the service is!  I read the reviews on here and can understand some negative ones but those people are idiots for what you get. This isn't a $50 a plate restaurant! So those people who are looking for perfection from a very affordable restaurant are "smoking" stuff!   My girl had the pizza which was really good, and I had the lasagna which was above average. I did love the complementary lemoncello shot, and the dessert.  The only negative was that the young waitress (very good-looking so I will overlook) brought out our plates one at a time and said some lame excuse that she didn't know we wanted them together. What? So we are going to eat separately? Obviously, there was a mixup but I'm prone to those so I'm not going to hold it over her because she was young and easy on the eyes. :)

Really great place, love the fact the the owner/chef came up to us and chatted with us a bit, gave us a shot of his MOST AMAZING made from scratch Limoncelo, definitely the best we ever had.  The dessert was delicious and same with the pizza.  But still nothing beats Cibo's Pizza for us, still by far the best we ever had, including New York, San Fran and anywhere in town.
This place is so delicious!! Matteo is an amazing owner!

We love it here! Pizza is amazing and the owner is amazing! We feel like we almost know him every time we come in! He's always so happy and greets you like friends:) we love trying all the pizzas and every single one has been amazing! Big wine list, fun drink list! This place is a go-to! :)

Had a tough day and I wanted to treat myself to a nice dinner. I drove to the downtown location, rather than the Glendale location, based on the reviews I read here. Big mistake. First, you have to pay for parking downtown. Even on the weekends and evenings. Second, even though the restaurant was mostly empty, they had no less than 6 employees on staff, each given a specific task. The person that greets you, seats you and gives you menu's. The busboy brings you water. The waitress takes your drink order and comes back with the drinks and then left us far too long before coming back to take our dinner order. The folks behind the counter seem to pour the drinks and make the food.  Our food was delivered to our table by the folks behind the counter. The waitress seems to have it pretty easy here compared to the typical duties of a waitress at just about any other restaurant, which is why it's hard for me to understand why we were never visited again by our waitress during our meal. She was too busy chatting it up with a couple seated at the bar. I glanced her way and stared several times, hoping to get her attention because my drink was empty and I'm basically choking down dry bread. My meal has to stop until I can get something to wash my food down with. I give up, I get up with my empty drink and I take it to the counter. The man behind the counter knows what I was drinking and offers to refill it and bring it back out to me.  Suddenly, lo-and-behold, our waitress appears. Why our waitress was so inattentive and couldn't take a 2 minute break from her conversation to check on her table (and then she could go back to her conversation) is beyond mind boggling to me.  Now, let's talk about the food. I ordered the Romana salad, which was way over-priced for what you get at $9.95. It's basically some lettuce, crutons and salad dressing. Not much to making it, not much to it at all.  I also ordered the Regina Margherita pizza ($12.95) and my drink, a Coke, at $2.50. These are not cheap prices and the level of service should be equal.  There were flies buzzing all around our table, so I wish I would have sat outside.   The pizza was good, but the tomato sauce was a bit too 'sharp' for my taste.   There is another, similar restaurant called La Piazza Al Forno. They also have locations in downtown Phoenix and Glendale. They are also VPN certified, and I think the menu has more variety, cheaper prices, and, in my experience, much better service.  The excuse offered to me regarding my waitresses inattentiveness was that she was quitting her job in a couple of days and was saying goodbye to some regular customers. Again, she didn't have to stop talking to them, she just needed to excuse herself for two minutes to check on other customers. Its unlikely I'll become a regular customer, in part, because the waitress left me feeling alienated, or less important.  The total was $25.40 with $2.11 tax for a grand total of $27.51. A 10% tip on the pretax total would have been $2.54. If I was taken care of, I would have left $6, but since I got irritated for being ignored, I left her $3.00, which considering the circumstances, I thought was generous of me.  Everyone has a limited job to do. The cooks did a good job. The greeter did a good job. The busboy did a good job. I'd go so far to say this restaurant doesn't need waitresses. She was the only one who screwed up, and all she had to do was check in on us from time to time. I think the folks behind the bar could have easily done her job and she would be free to talk to her friends all day, every day. The customer would be taken care of and everyone would be happy. its a win-win-win situation. I cannot emphasize enough how easy the wait-staff has it at this location.  As for any after dinner treats delivered to your table after the meal (again, based on reviews I read here), I didn't get that. I got a bill. The waitress was fast to deliver the bill and to check back to collect the bill and deliver the receipt. Noted.  I found the food here to be good but over-priced and La Piazza Al Forno to offer similar food, that I think tastes better, at a cheaper price and with much better service.

I love it here. The portions are perfect and the drinks are splendid! The staff is friendly and welcoming always. The location is very cool but it is a little small. Great place to eat pizza on a Friday night.

Very good overall. Ordered the mushroom soup and bruschetta. Soup was outstanding,  bruschetta was quite bland and disappointing unfortunately. Their style of pizza is outstanding and the combination of ingredients and the freshness of the taste is wonderful. Service was quite well also: recommended!
Great pizza and exceptionally fast service. We barely had gotten our order placed before it was on the table. The tiramisu was excellent as well.

The pizza here is phenomenal.  The best margherita pizza in Phoenix.  I came in on a lunch break during the week and sat at the bar.  I'm not exaggerating when I say I sat there for over 10 minutes before anyone approached me.  I was quite disconsolate when I walked in and didn't feel like talking to anyone so I felt content to just sit there and watch the female (only) staff of servers walk back and forth in front of me- trying not to make eye contact because then they'd have to take my order.  As I watched them interact together, I realized that none of them liked each other.  In fact, it was like watching a commercial for the Bad Girls reality TV show but this was more entertaining.  Finally, a chef approached the bar to make himself a drink of water, feeling rather thirsty I said "hey, do you mind if I get one of those, too?"  He was more than happy to make me one and asked me what I would like to eat and I told him I wanted a margherita pizza.  Within literally minutes my hot and fresh pizza was out.  The Chefs name was Mateo and he was freaking awesome. The owner also came by and made sure I had everything I needed including a nice tall Peroni to go with my delicious pie.  I can't wait to come back in and get served by the guys while I watch the waitresses claw each others eyes out.  Dinner and a show.
Their pizza is alright. I still think Spinato's pizza is the best! But their location is amazing because it's near Downtown, Phoenix.

Tried both the margherita pizza and the roma salad... both were just absolute perfection.  I can't imagine a world where the flavors or ingredients for either are better.    It was a breezy fall's eve, so sitting outside was the right choice.  Service was great, drinks were cold - and after finishing off the 'za and salad, the chef came out with a taste of his special homemade limoncello.  That's what he called it at least, 'cept it was in an Everclear bottle.    Apparently more than a shot of it could cause liver-failure and diabetes at the same time - 'cause it was deliciously sweet, and thick enough that it coats your throat like lemon flavored cough syrup.    It was a nice touch, and the chef, despite not knowing a ton of English, was very kind.  I will be back to try other dishes, I can't see making a bad choice at this establishment.

Went to Pomo last night with my partner and a friend. We were not impressed.  Pollo salad-chicken was under seasoned and dry. The bread served with it was also dry and didn't taste good.  Margarita pizza-the sauce had no flavor. The basil was cooked-this is a big no no to me.  Pr√≠ncipe pizza-too much olive oil and too much Parmesan cheese. Too salty. I've had this pizza before at another restaurant and the salt should be balanced.   Our server never came back to ask how any of our food was. I had to flag him down for drink refills. Keep in mind that there were only 5 tables seated while we were there and there was plenty of staff in the restaurant. At the end of the meal when he noticed there were only two pieces of the Pr√≠ncipe pizza eaten and we declined a box he ask is something was wrong. At this time I told him the problems we had with the pizza that I've described here, he removed the pizza and boxed it up-I'm assuming to save for himself, which I don't have a problem with-but still charged me for it.   I wouldn't say the food is bad, but it is not worth the price. Go to Fired Pie and save some money, or if you want a pizza that is truly worth $17 then go to Pizzeria Bianco.
Seriously fantastic pizza. TON of fun just looking at this menu, and watching all the variety be served. Really enjoyed going here. Only went a few times yet enjoyed it very much every time!

Gem!!! What a fantastic little restaurant. Exceptional food and even better service.  You can feel the fresh ingredients and the pizza cooks right in front of you.  The owner comes out and pours a desert liquor. This is a piece of Italy in American Southwest.  Dont miss.

Authentic pizza and pastas! Pasta cooked al dente! Service was welcoming, prompt, friendly and accommodating. Our sweet waitress went on & beyond and even modified one of pasta dishes despite it says on the menu "no add ons". I ordered a mista salad and it was drenched in dressing- I am recommending having dressing on the side.  Beer on tap & water glasses were never empty! I loved that I could see the wood burning pizza over from my table! Everyone who was over 21 got a super yummy shot of lemoncello- ON THE HOUSE after dinner. The ambiance was cozy. I would recommend making reservation since there were not that many tables. Salute!
The pizza here is definitely good. It's a little pricey but worth a try. I do enjoy brick oven pizza and the atnosphere is pretty neat (dare I say "romantic"?) I may return sometime with the wife.

My sister and I went here for lunch today. I wanted to see if the pizza really tasted like I remember from Naples, and they have $2 bottled beer on Sundays! We both had the Italian lager, split a mista salad and ordered the traditional Bufala pizza. The salad came out first, and was huge! The greens were fresh, the grape tomatoes flavorful and the shaved parmesan was very good. The chef brings out a small bottle of aged balsamic for the dressing. Next came the pizza, which was piping hot, and topped with melting bufala mozzarella. It was delicious, just as I remembered. I will definitely be back!

Hands down the best Italian/Brick oven Pizza in Phoenix. And you pay a premium for it.  The salads are fresh and tasty, the pizza is full of flavor, yet not heavy or greasy.  Wait time on busy weekends can take a bit, but the bar with outdoor seating is a great place to wait.  Everyone I've encountered is always friendly and helpful.  I like the nice touch of the fried dough sticks with powder sugar at the end of the meal.  Once in a while, you get offered a complimentary shot which is an added bonus if you drink.

Great environment, very good service and good food. We are started off with a meat and cheese board that was great. All the components were very flavorful and I highly recommend it. For the meal we knocked out the peppino pizza. If your looking for a pizza with fresh ingredients, this is the spot. Personally, I could go with more cheese and sauce but that's just how I like it and not knocking it. For dessert, the tiramisu was yummy and recommended. Overall, a quality time out.

From beginning to end everything was amazing. The bruchetta was so simple but tasted delicious. The pizza tasted amazing. Flavor was really good.  But i love anything with arugula. Could not eat the whole pizza def enough for 2. The cannolis were simple tasted good nothing special. The owner however gave us a shot of something with lemon and it was thick and creamy. Tasted like lemon cluster with some alcohol. Service was super friendly.

Mio Dio, this review is LONG overdue. I am so lucky that these guys are so close. This is one of the places I like to go when I am missing Europe. These charming little spot oozes Neapolitan charm from the atmosphere to the mouthwatering pizza, salads and pasta.  These guys are definite top contenders for best pizza joint in The Valley in my opinion. Don't get me wrong: I LOVE Bianco, The Parlor and my beloved Bocce up in Cottonwood, but there is something about this place that really stands out for me and I think it is the European atmosphere.  Lisa E. dragged me in here one weekend and I am eternally indebted to her for that. The first thing I noticed it that I heard a LOT of Italian being spoken-ALWAYS a good sign!  I had the Pomo, what can I say, I'm simple and predictable. It was like having fresh meat and veggies, fresh cheese and savory sauce on a fresh baked crust sent from heaven. I'm not a pizza guy, I will NEVER suggest going out for pizza but these guys are an exception. Their pizza is not too heavy which is how a lot of pizza places utterly fail and the freshness and quality of ingredients is what really sets Pomo apart.   I've also had the lasagne bolognese. Again, I'm not a huge fan of lasagne again because it is often so damned rich and heavy. Pomo pulls it off brilliantly AND they give you so much that you have lunch for tomorrow!  They have amazing salads which are huge and full of lush, fresh veggies and their bruschetta is to die for.  Lastly, their coffee kicks ass. This is what really takes me back to Europe: amazing, AUTHENTIC Italian Espresso. I WISH these guys were open in the morning because I would come here for coffee EVERY DAY!  The space is great: they have an awesome little bar and a patio for the months when it's nice outdoors and some counter seating where you can watch your meal being prepared.  If you haven't been here, put Pomo on your 2015 list to check out. If you're from out of town, these guys are not to be missed!

Was just visiting Phoenix area for a few days. I happened to google and find this restaurant.. The website made it look awesome so I really wanted to try it -- This was the BEST decision!    The look and feel of the place was great, very friendly staff who was happy to answer all of our questions.  We started with some salads and sorrentina.. Both tasted great. The star of it all was obviously the Pizza!!  It was the best pizza (and I live in Chicago, so I know :-P hahaha! only joking) But seriously! we ordered a margherita, Toto Sapore, and Peppino!  All were delicious!    The cherry on top of our time there was when Matteo, the chef, came out personally and gave us all a shot of his homemade Limoncello! He was very nice and talked with us for a bit and even let us take a picture with him. (we were complete tourist on this trip!)  :-)    Great place, if you are in the Phoenix area and haven't made a stop by this place.. What are you waiting for?!

Pomo is possibly one of the best pizza spots in Phoenix, and there are a few. Napoli would be proud of what is being served up at this quaint little place. It's a winner.  Why go there: Central Ave is full of good places to eat downtown. This place stands out because of the quality and consistency of their pizzas. They had pizzas that took me back to my childhood where this Italian man from Napoli, in Paris (no less), would crank out about 80 pies on select nights in our neighborhood, from his wood fired oven built in his obscure van.. The Pomo fam is for real.  Their pies are tossed into this stone oven, wood burning oven, possibly holding a 900 degree heat, and come out lighting fast. Their Neapolitan pizzas are truly a reminder of what Italian food tastes like in Italy. Sauces are not thick and heavy, everything is balanced and fresh. The apps and dessert card are solid with plenty to choose from but not too diverse. Service is always solid and they know their stuff.  Don't miss: Two pizzas stand out, the Diavola if you enjoy a little kick from a spicy salami. And a white pizzas with four cheeses, the Quattro Fromaggi.  They also have a killer house made gnocchi that will surely please, that's a good main dish to share actually as an appetizer actually. Hope you are humble enough to ask for a good wine pairing, because what you get here will surely elevate their offerings. Their desserts... really, almost any of them will do. We've tried them all (don't judge). Our soft spot is for the panna cotta... we'll have two please.  Tip: If you can and don't mind, try to sit at the bar where they make the pizzas, it's fascinating, the guys craft those pies with love and precision. It's refreshing, get a good front row seat if you're not looking to gaze into each other's eyes over dinner. This is gonna be equally as fun. The GM will come by after your meal for a round of limoncello on the house for the table. Not a bad way to see you off, so hang tight and save a bit of room for that last little goodie... Salute!

best pizza I have had downtown or probably ever. so authentic & tasty. it's a little pricey but the service and food you get is beyond amazing. on almost every visit we have had the owner will come out & poor the table a taste of a new drink or bring us a yummy dessert for free! I highly recommend this restaurant!

O solo mio!  So glad we found this place on our drive through town.  Thought I'd never have pizza like this unless I went back to Italy.  So yummy!  Sat by the bar and no doubt everything is fresh!  They are shaving cheese right in front of us!  Pizza, dessert and shots of limon cello!  We'll be back!

DON'T ORDER TAKEOUT.  Not only will you get their extremely uneven food - really, that's what you call a Caprese salad when your lasagne and pizza is excellent?  But you have to run the gauntlet of the clueless, unsupervised phone staff plus the arrogant know-it-all servers.  Will take great pains to stay away from the place in the future.

We called nearly a week ahead to make a reservation for a party of 14. When we got there, they had no record of having taken our reservation, and said they could only accommodate us outside (on a cold, blustery evening). We repeated that we had made a reservation and politely asked to see the manager. While we were waiting, the hostess that had been talking to us seated a couple of parties that walked in with no reservation at all, including one larger party of 6. Then when the manager finally came over, all he wanted to do was argue with us about whether we had called the right location to make our reservation. We ended up leaving and taking our business to the restaurant next door. I don't care how good your food is, if you cannot care for your customers properly, you will not get my business. Sorry, Pomo, but you suck.

If this is authentic Italian pizza, put me on a jet to Italy PRONTO! Location is great, parking is metered or you pay to park in a lot. $1.20 in change got me roughly 46 minutes on the meter. Seated at the inside bar (there are 2 bars, 1 inside and 1 outside). D√©cor is nice and outdoor space is perfect for lovely weather. Service was quick and pleasant, even with a personal run through of the menu. My Margherita pizza came out in under 5 minutes and was bigger than the plate it was served on. I was told since the dough is thin it's not all that scary to eat but decided to eat half and save room for dessert. Before dessert came out, the chef brought out a mini dessert of fried dough and powered sugar. Simple yet waited for my cake. Sooo glad I did, the nutella torta was AMAZING! I didn't get a lot of nutella flavor but the hazelnuts and chocolate were divine!  Will come back for sure!
I've nev er had better pizza than this, and the Mista Salad was awesome.

Amazing food!  My husband & I shared the Bruschetta, the romaine salad and the Pomo Pizza!  Perfect for two, with a great cozy atmosphere and attentive staff.  We will definitely come back here again on our next trip!

Mmmmm!!!!!!!  Visions of the beautiful Italian countryside ambush my head at with first bite of the decadent pizza in my hand. The crispy crust made the perfect balance of a saucy masterpiece. Flowing cheese grazed my chin as I embrace this rich experience! I'm still infatuated as I eat the last bite. Sadly-(sigh). I might also mention the fabulous soup and enthusiasm of the service of Selenae, our server. Her intuitive manner satisfied our every desire and whim. Wow! We will never forget our experience at the Pomo.
I loved this place. The pizza was authentic and delicious. We went on a weeknight so there wasn't too many people but with this place being small, searing may be an issue when they're busy.

This could possibly be the best pizza I have had. I have 3 pizza places that stick out in my mind and this is one of them. It is a tough competition between here, Pizzeria Bianco and Il Bosco. The pizza is cooked to perfection and the sauce is absolutely perfect. Quality ingredients and it is extremely satisfying. The service was also great, just wish it was a little cheaper.

Maybe my Northeastern roots have made me a pizza snob but I wasn't too impressed.  I realize that the pizza is VPN certified and that it has such fawning reviews but I thought it was just OK.  I liked Cibo better.  Honestly, I liked Grimaldi's of Scottsdale better.  However, their service, their atmosphere, and their deserts were fantastic.  I'm not saying don't go, just don't expect the Mona Lisa to eye you enviously as you chomp down on a slice.

Came in for lunch and ordered the equivalent to a meat lover's pizza. The pizza was quite good and came out fast. Definitely had the brick oven flavor. But, I think the toppings were just ok, and the wait staff wasn't very attentive. I had to wait a long time to get refills on my water more than once, and he seemed distracted by side work when it wasn't even really that busy. There are plenty of good pizza spots in downtown Phx, so in order for me to want to come back, they'll have to step it up a bit more.

Loved the pizza and burrata at Pomo! Super cute outdoor patio that's perfect for night dining or days with great weather. Our service was awesome and our pizzas came out quickly and melted in our mouths

Cute little place, pizza was awesome and their Italian sodas made for a nice little addition. The staff was friendly, we sat outside and it was a cool night. Funny that this place was right across the street from a Pizza Hut.
"Quick pizza that tasted yum", said my son Ethan!  We loved it.  Definitely would come back.
Great Food. Very Authentic people and food. They did all the little things that make you feel like they value your business. I would recommend to anybody looking for authentic Italian pizza/food.

Worst experience out in a long while. Service wasn't just slow, it was blatantly oblivious. In the middle of a 45 minute wait for a plate of bread I saw a manager, but only in that I saw her ineffectually milling about doing nothing (certainly not keeping an eye on the satisfaction of patrons). Wasn't offered anything while I waited. When I asked for a refund for the bread the waiter sad sure then threw it, uneaten, in the trash right in front of me. I guess this place really needed to drive the point home that they don't care. Message received. And the pasta I waited for with an empty glass no one offered to refill? Overcooked, unseasoned, and frankly kind of gross to eat. Nope.

We've been lots of times and always had a great experience. This visit was not the food and service we've grown to love at this place.  - Burrata salad- creamy, but didn't have much flavor. Salt helped the cheese, but nothing could help the tomatoes. The tasteless chunks were flavorless and far from heirloom quality. The homemade fig jam listed on the menu was missing from our plate. Not worth $15. - Kale-Romana salad- ($10)- the name is a little misleading. There were a few pieces of kale, but it was mostly romaine lettuce. Fine, but disappointed by the bait and switch. - Ortolana pizza was good (better with a bit of crushed red and parm). - Carbonara pizza was OK. There was plenty of creamy sauce and chunks of crispy pancetta, but if there were onions or egg (as the menu listed) I didn't notice them.  The place was busy, but it always is, so not sure why service was a little scattered. We waited 35 min for our salads and there was a really long lag between the two pizzas, even though there didn't appear to be any others going in and and of the oven during the interim. The second round of drinks we ordered never arrived and we had to ask for our water to be refilled. Definitely not the norm, so I would return to give it another try. Hopefully this was just an off night.
Our go to restaurant every time we come downtown!! Everything on the menu is amazing! If you're a picky eater like me I suggest the Margherita pizza. Also you must try the creme br√ªl√©e.
The customer service was good. The place is nice and the food was great. It can be a little pricey but if you're in Arizona and like a thin crust pizza then go try it.

Great bruschetta and even greater pizza. I usually go to the Scottsdale location, but this place was even better. The staff was nice and friendly as well. Paula was the coolest server I've had in a while. She was very nice and had us laughing the whole time. Overall I would come to this location again. Right in the heart of downtown Phoenix you can sit, eat and get out of the crazy city life while eating your fine dine pizza.
WOW! Great food, friendly staff! Had the calzone and it was huge! This is legit Italian food! Worth the stop outside of downtown!

We were downtown visiting our brother who lives in ASU dorms and wanted to take him out for birthday dinner. Pomo was walking distance and had great reviews so it seemed like a perfect place and that it was! Thank you Billy for messing with the heaters that we insisted on bc we were cold but had to sit outside. Thank you Michelle for all the wonderful suggestions and for being so patient while our family of six took forever to order. The food and service were outstanding making us anxious for our next visit....and just when we thought this dinning experience can't get any better here comes birthday desert for brother and the owner with shots of  limoncello! Thank you for a fabulous evening:)

Food was excellent. We had two salads they were both great. One was similar to a caeser. It was yummy! The second was the pollo salad. It had chicken, avocado, pine nuts and a lemon dressing. It was my favorite out of the two. We then had a couple pizzas. I must say that all the ingredients were so fresh. It was really good food. The reason for the four stars was our service. While the food came out timely, the server seemed like she disliked her job. She wasn't very friendly and she was often MIA. Took a while to get our check too. Lastly we got desserts and they were great too! I would definitely go back. Hopefully we have a better waitress next time.

If there were 10 stars I would give this place 12!  Don't let the simplicity fool you.  Great food, great service.  Amazing authentic Italian pizza.  Everything is imported, even the oven!!  You will not be disappointed!

Came here a few nights ago. We ordered the Quattro (can't remember the full name). Size was perfect for two people and it was delish! Great service too! Will definitely go back to keep trying their other pizzas!

I'll start with the negative to get that out of the way: During off hours (just as they opened) we got what I hope was a brand-spanking-new-waitress, so even though she was extremely nice, I can't say the service from our point person was anything better than OK at best. The restaurant is much better than deserving of nit picking, and since she'll be better with a little time, my rating cuts some slack & overlooks some problems with 1 person's lack of experience (for the record: unopened beers without an opener, bread and olive oil coming out after appetizers, and having to take food to go because of an organizational error on her part-we asked for antipasti & pizzas at the same time, but didn't happen). We did have two rambunctious boys getting fussy, this waitress and everyone there were very understanding and friendly with them. In honesty, this is a very nice restaurant that we probably shouldn't be bringing kids to anyway, so some of the blame is ours. Besides her, everyone else seemed extremely competent.  However, the food was excellent, fresh with great ingredients. We started with the bruschetta, and although we had to split 2 pieces between 3 people, it was fresh throughout with quality mozzarella and buttery rich olive oil. The other appetizer, veggie plate with olive oil, was good-not-great, felt like I could make the exact same thing pretty easily at home. Bread on the table was standard warm Italian bread, and the olive oil provided was lacking or they forgot to bring out the good EVOO, but didn't eat much of the fillers so wasn't an issue.  Bonus points for chef and staff speaking to each other in Italian, also for Duvel on tap. Great cute date place, intimate setting, cool atmosphere and decorations. I'd rather come here than most other higher end places we've found in Phoenix.  Pizzas were fantastico! I've spent cumulative years in Italy, and this could be something you'd find there. Not sure if they import Neopolitan water like at some places, but whatever they're doing it seems very close to what you'd find in Campania. I got the Pizza Principe off the "classic pizzas" menu, crust was perfect thickness and salt level, sauce was fresh and tasty, prosciutto and arugula added salt and savor to it all, Parmesean rounded the edges of flavors off nicely. We got a pizza margarita for the kids, and I couldn't stop eating that either, again great crust and sauce, and not too much cheese. My wife couldn't stop raving about the "cheese-less pizza." Overall a very authentic and satisfying experience. Will be back, and even if it's a new waiter/waitress again, it'll still be worth it. Small place though, so might be a wait during weekend evening hours. Wish I had more time to try the home made Limoncello.

This restaurant is authentic.  Really authentic. Their pizza oven is imported from Naples!  Success. Their pizza kitchen is open with modern decor.  As a customer, I can watch them make the pizza.  Success!  Their Arugula and Bufala pizzas are really good. Along with their Lemon Drop drink.  I would drive back to Phoenix, Arizona just to eat the pizza here. Yes, it is that serious.

Being an industry person, it was very difficult for me to walk in 30 minutes before closing...but we had just seen a movie and we hadn't seen each other for awhile and we were all hungry. We were greeted with warmth and hospitality and efficient friendly service from David, a tall, handsome young man with a warm smile and gentle demeanor. He made us feel comfortable and never rushed us. The manager was just as sweet and we truly appreciated this. The food was awesome! A salad with mangoes, a Pomo pizza and a white pizza with prosciutto and mushrooms! The spicy olive oil is delish, too. We did have one other pizza but I don't remember the name but we added arugula to it! Yummy! Quaint atmosphere, friendly staff, great food. We will be back. Thank you!

Im giving this place the ine star simply because I enjoyed the crust on the pizza. But, the hostess, besides sitting down and leaving her post to be with her friends (so did other waitor/ waitress, so im not sure if it was the owners or something) was actually nice. Our witress was very ingenuine and not helpful. She simply did a the minimum: asked for our order and brought us food. First, we asked for water because we were super thirsty, but my boyfriend pointed out all the crap that was in it, little black peices that looked like dead bugs to me. Also, their tables were sloppily cleaned, white on top, but full of dirt and pizza souce on the edges. Finally, we got our very small and unsatisfying 17$ pizza. Thats right SMALL, meant for one person.

Rude rude rude. Horrible customer service, we parked just across the street but we didn't have change to feed the meter. We sat down and were looking at the menu but we were concerned about the parking so we asked our server if she can break a 20 so we can feed the meter and she sent my husband to the hostess, so she went to the bartender and he was soooooo mean!!!he made an ugly hand sign to indicate that there was no change...so we walked out.  Please be nice to customers since we are the ones who keep a business going. We were prepared to spend over $100

The word on the street is that Pomo is where it's at.  I have tested that theory, and it proves to be true.  This place is fantastically tasty and has the best service I have encountered in a very long time.  My hubby and I were hungry after Yelp's Downtown Revival Event and we had seen Pomo at the event.  They obviously support Yelp, which means Yelpers must support them.    We walked in around 9pm, so it was only about half full.  We took a seat at the bar and ordered two glasses of wine.  The wine is all reasonably priced.  We ordered the Margherita pizza and added mushrooms (which might be a crime against humanity in Italy but that's how we like it).  We also spilt a salad to share.  The pizza was perfectly cooked.  Unlike some other Neapolitan pizza joints, this pizza had an even char across the entire pie.  It was an amazing pizza and you could tell that all the ingredients were the absolute best quality.  The bartender and our server for the evening, David, was making a delicious looking martini with hibiscus and peach schnapps so I went ahead and ordered one for myself as well.  I don't remember what it was called (the first glass of wine had already gone to my head) but it was one heck of a great martini.  For dessert, we ordered the cr√®me brulee which came with strawberries and raspberries on top.  It had amazing vanilla bean flavor and you could see the flecks of vanilla bean in the custard.    I have to say that the service from David definitely put this place over the top in terms of quality for us.  Give that man a raise!

This is an "official-authentic" Italien restaurant, and I frequent it regularly. But it is not just basic - it is gourmet.  My favorite waitress is Marie, and she waited on me today. She should probably be given some sort of award or something as the best waitress I have ever had.   There is LIVE basil hanging on the wall. For real. Just walk up and see for yourself.   The olive oil is unbelievable.   I giant copper covered Pizza oven adds to the environment.   If you care, the salads are all organic. And the optional chicken on the salads is organic raised.   They have both gluten free and regular food.   I have never had anything that was less than "unbelievably good" at this restaurant.   On the other side of the restaurant is a small cafe that opens in the morning before the main restaurant. (Cafe is closed Sunday) It is the best expresso machine in Scottsdale, with the owner of the restaurant (sometimes) who actually knows how to make a real expresso or cappuccino. You should understand how rare this is. Note: The express or coffee you get in the main restaurant comes from the same expresso machine.   The pasteries remind me of being back in Italy.   You are not going to find an Italien place like this very often.   *Please take it easy on the wait staff, and please give them positive feedback when you write a review. These folks work hard, and are subject to a lot of reviews online, because this restaurant is growing in popularity.  One night I took my entire staff to eat here, and we were treated like royalty, even though the place was super busy.   Warning:  The one negative thing I would say is that Pomo's destroys the Pizza-eating experience for me when I go to other pizza restaurants. When I try eating what passes for pizza elsewhere, I just think to myself "this is definitely not Pomo's. ; - )   - Russell Wright

With coworkers, they wanted pizza. I'm usually a chain kind of pizza guy, used to the bell peppers, olives, and mushrooms. This place is a wood fire oven place with ingredients that I can not even pronounce. If I can't pronounce it, it's not going in my mouth. I chose a pizza that had cheese, sauteed onions, and Italian bacon. I really enjoyed it for the tomato sauce was slightly sweet which went well with the saltiness of the bacon. I actually ate the whole pizza. Yummy.

Wow, this place is awesome!!!   The service and food are great!!!  They have a great variety of pizza, all of which sound delicious, and homemade pastas which we didn't get to try.  All of the pizzas are super thin crust Neapolitan style, made in their wood fired oven using oak, and mostly using imported Italian ingredients.  We shared the Peppino pizza (tomato sauce, mozzarella, ricotta, spicy salame, basil, evoo) and it was so deeply flavorful.  Highly recommended!
So.  Good.  Would eat here every single day if able.  I split a margherita with my two young kids - size was just right.  ... try to avoid facing the door near sunset.  Liiiittle bright.

Authentic, Fresh, & Delicious! Service was prompt & polite-Bonus Points for the Chef personally delivering a complimentary dessert and homemade cinnamon liqueur at the end of the meal! Definitely a new favorite!
Went for lunch this place was simply awesome !! Salad was very good !! pizza was excellent  (I had the Sorrento). But , best of all ...the Panini's, The bread is made in the wood burning over .

Central phoenix has tons of great pizza (which I eat quite frequently), so I was excited to try this place and it's certified pizzas. Pizza preferences are very subjective, so about all I can say is that I ordered four different pizzas, and while I thought they were all quite good, nothing stood out as "the best" of what you can get in the area. (Specifically, I thought they lacked a bit in flavor and were heavy on the olive oil.) If Pizzaria Bianco and Cibo weren't nearby, this would be a good choice, but I'd recommend those other two places over this one.

My boss recommended this place and since he is someone of high importance, I trust him. Not because he's my boss, but because part of his job description is "to entertain and take employees and clients out to eat" so duh, he eats alot!  We get seated outside on the patio. The weather was gorgeous and we ordered the Toto Sapore and the Crostini. The crostini was ok - it was similar to a brushcetta board: one with ricotta, one with mushrooms, and one with salmon.  It was ok and I probably would not order it again.  The Toto Sapore: Italian Sausage, Pancetta (Bacon), Salame Piccante, Prosciutto Cotto (Ham) was amazingly good! The crust was thin and crunchy, and the sauce was not too thick.  I loved it!  After our entrees, we were given complimentary fried wonton chips (not sure if they are called any other name) and powdered sugar.  It was a sweet gesture, but it didn't taste that great so we opted to order the Hazelnut chocolate cake - it was incredible! It was so rich so we took half of it home and that thing was gone before bed that night.    Our server was a little slow on service, but I was fine with it since I was enjoying the beautiful weather.  Pomo, I'll be back!

We stopped by Pomo to fulfill a post-happy hour carb craving! We order the Peppino pizza, which has a great spicy flavor from the hot salami on it! You can tell from the taste that they use high quality of ingredients on their pizza! My only wish was that the center of the pizza was a little more well done. It was a little soggy for my preference. I thought the size of the pizza was perfect for two to split. In fact, we had an extra slice leftover. If we had been more hungry, adding an appetizer or salad would have been great. The prices were really reasonable too! The server was really hospitable and even offered us a free shot of limoncello!

Excellent! My wife and I tried this place while staying in Phoenix for a conference. We had the eggplant parmigiana to start, a Margherita pizza, and finished it off with tiramisu and espressos. I couldn't tell you which was my favorite because it was all so good. The sauce was amazing. And very reasonably priced which was the cherry on top.
Amazingly delicious pizza, fantastic customer service an a personal thank you from the owner made eating at Pomo something I look forward to doing again.

Authentic Italian Pizza- they knocked it out of the park! The good was fresh and full of flavor. Staff was friendly and service was excellent. I wish they had a sampler of everything on the menu, we wanted to try everything! This will definitely be a new favorite must on our visits to Phoenix! Excellent !

This place knows what they are doing! Great service, food and atmosphere. This is the second time coming to Pomo Pizzeria and both times were exceptional. Even middle of the week and there were plenty of people in the restaurant. The only reason I did not give 5-star is the lack of a happy hour and a poor red wine selection.

Came here for a quick lunch with coworkers. I usually don't get vegetarian pizza but decided to try it out. I got the ortolana pizza and wow absolutely delicious! The pizza was not too sauce leaving it soaking and the crust was just crispy enough. I 100% recommend trying this restaurant if you're craving good pizza!

I eat here a lot! I love the Daiya shreds and gluten free crust option! Don't worry, this place is very authentic! If you are lucky to be here when the owner is in, be sure to drink the limoncello. Everything here is delicious!

This place is amazing finest italian food and the best italian style pizza u have ever had. Check out the pictures.. We walked in and this italian accented man sat us down and and explained everything to is the pizza are mad in a brick oven and much more and the chef is a genius with his art in making italian food it was very unique. But this is the place to be if u want pasta pizza and many other italian foods and the price was low per plate I was very surprised. Awesome place
I love this place. Great service and keep coming back for the principe pizza and my son for their chocolate cake.

We really enjoyed our meal, the pizza was delicious, the beer was cold. The service was friendly. The owner even came out and gave us free desert and lemoncello for free. It today made my day and we plan on going back again soon.

Just had an amazing experience! Hate to admit this but hands down one of the best pizzas I have had! The staff was great and very friendly. I was craving an after dinner caffeine fix and our bartender recommended the cutest little espresso drink... I told her I don't like coffee and it was perfect, right on point! The chef brought us out some complimentary sample desserts and limoncello shots... Words can't even describe how delicious! Well done Pomo, you just got some regulars for life!!

Pomo was delicious!  Great atmosphere, great food, and excellent service!   And the men of Pomo are delicious!  Handsome staff starting with the Manager!  And the owner has a sex appeal to him as well!  Great job Pomo!  I definitely will be back for more food!

We were here back in January and could not wait to come back. They did not disappoint. Sat at the bar with David again he is so awesome. A great multi tasker. Looking forward to coming again in August when we are here for move in week at GCU.

This is far one of my favorite places. The bartender, David, is amazing and a great asset to this restaurant. He's very knowledgeable on the menu and wine choices. Owner is usually there cooking too. Delicious food and great service.

Liked it so much I took a group of 15 people there the next night...  Loved it!  I was there just the night before for Valentine's Day and it was great then.  This is a fun place for small to mid sized groups....

I can't imagine this place ever getting a bad review.   Remarkable service & food.   Two of us ordered the Toto Sapore and we spared nothing. It was absolutely delicious and fresh.   The complimentary pastry and limoncello is a nice touch and surprise!  It is fun to watch the pizza guys hustle around the oven.   I definitely recommend going here.

Amazing pizza!  Amazing customer service! Great atmosphere! Fair prices! What more could you want? =)  Special Note: every time I have ate here one of the owners/managers checks in to make sure we are taken care of and ALWAYS brings a free desert and shots of Lemon-cello on the house.  Keeps me coming back!  Highly recommend!
Friendly servers! Lightning fast food prep!! Literally like 5 mins after you order!...and for a pizza!!! Very affordable and located in a perfect part of Phoenix to take a stroll after dinner!!!

Not sure what was up with their bar service; maybe only one person was 21 or over but our party on a Friday late afternoon/evening had a nearly impossible time getting drink orders as well as getting them correct!  We were a large party but they knew we were coming days in advance.  They had us out on the patio but the patio bar was not open (???) and all orders had to be taken inside to the main bar.  Some in our group had the pizzas and were apparently satisfied because I didn't see any of it go back but they have got to do something about the service or at least explain to folks what's going on (we humans can be very understanding)

Vegan review: Pomo's downtown location is small but pleasant. They offer several vegan (or can be made vegan) options (pizza, pasta, bruschetta, anti-pasta and of course salads) and use what I assume is Daiya vegan cheese. The vegan pizza has a nice thin crust and excellent tomato sauce. They put the cheese on a little heavily though, so it can get a bit overwhelming. I usually ask them to cook it well done so the vegan cheese melts completely. It's not the very best vegan pie in town, but it is tasty! I've had the bruschetta before as well, and it's a meal itself. I believe the minestrone is vegan (it's marked as vegetarian) and tried it once, but wasn't that impressed. It was a bit bland. The bread served with it is excellent though!  What I really appreciate is how clearly they've marked the menu to indicate what is vegetarian and/or vegan. It makes ordering so much easier! The service is always great, and the location has a nice covered patio for the days and nights when the heat isn't too overwhelming. Most of the parking nearby is metered, and it can get very full during school days because it's so close to ASU's downtown campus. There's usually not a problem finding a spot in the late afternoon or evening though.

This place has a great atmosphere and amazing food. Pomo by far beats out its competition in the downtown/midtown area. The wine selection is excellent and fairly priced. It really gives Phoenix a city feel - something Phoenix tends to lack. I recommend the Pizza Chef and Romana salad. Another ++  portions are big enough that you can potentially share and not walk out stuffed.  The only recommendation I have is mounting the dining room tables, it is almost like a maze walking through the dining area and the tables move easily.   I can't wait for Pomo to open in Glendale!

The food is so fresh and flavorful! I enjoyed everything that I ate which included: a salad, a glass of wine, and the Alfonso pizza. My friend and I even got a complimentary dessert and shots on the house. Nothing better then that!!!
Very nice setting.  Oven seems at the right temp but you can't fault them for the flour available. For Phoenix this is an excellent option for true pizza neapolitana.

Brought my dad here for Father's Day lunch. Such an amazing experience!  We started off with a Caprese salad with some of the best mozzarella I've ever had. It came with a few pieces of bread and they bring you a few bottles of different olive oils and balsamic vinegar - all great. I also got an imported blood orange soda that came with the bottle.  We decided to go with the 'meat lovers' style pizza - ham, salami and Italian sausage. It's on a thinner crust cooked in a wood fire brick oven. I love the smokey flavour that adds to it. The sauce was perfect and not too thick and again, amazing quality cheese.  We turned down dessert because we were pretty full but the owner came over to introduce himself and poured us two shots of house-made limoncello and gave us a plate of fried dough with powdered sugar. Both were amazing and it was just so kind! I would definitely order limoncello for myself there again. It was pretty strong but not overwhelming, and I just love lemon and cr√®me. But then when we're just about to leave, he comes over again with two beautiful cherry and chocolate cannoli, saying, "I can't let you leave without trying my famous cannoli!" The cannoli filling was perfect and it was such a generous gesture, it made me feel really welcome. I've never had that happen in a restaurant before and you can tell the owner takes pride in what he does.  The pizza, salad, and soda (more than enough food for two) with a generous tip was under $40. Add in the free desert and it's a hell of a great deal.  The background music was also perfect - Sinatra followed by Mumford & Sons followed by Dean Martin? Yes.  I can't recommend this restaurant enough. I'm so glad it's in downtown Phoenix instead of Scottsdale because I would never have gone!

I had the opportunity to try Pomo summer of '13. I'm not from the area and wanted to try something local and authentic. Well BAM!! Pomo was it!!! I've tried authentic pizza from Napoli and this was it!!!! I was very impressed with the fresh flavor and the awesome service. The cooks were great and the owner was a charm! When I go visit family again I will definitely be stoping by to get my Pomo fix!!! Yum!! Yum!!

The best Napoletana pizza I've had outside Naples. We were visiting from out of town and chose this place based on yelp reviews.  I had the Toto Sapore pizza, which did not disappoint.  My mom ordered the Contadina and enjoyed every bite.  Our waitress gave us great service and was very helpful since it was our first time.  The chef was very friendly and generous.  We received a complementary dessert and shot of crema di limoncello. This was the best crema di limoncello I've ever had, including my visit to Naples.

I can't say enough about Pomo, but everything I can say is good...no....great.  I like pizza, I love great pizza, I therefore love Pomo downtown.   Having tried the pizza at many of the valley's "top spots", Pomo is my favorite.   I would rank it above any other pizza I've had the pleasure of enjoying in Arizona, maybe even anywhere, and that includes the few pizzas I tried in Italy.   It's also worth mentioning that if you're a valley pizza snob like me, you've probably tried that certain place in downtown PHX that's received a lot of publicity and high praise from the press.  You know the one I'm talking about.  Well, my taste buds tell me that Pomo is the hands down winner in that race.    With a great big pizza oven right out in the open, a nice selection of apps, salads and pastas,  incredible selection of both red & white pizzas (or build-your-own), a great wine, cocktail and beer list, a great location and of course great service, Pomo checks ALL the boxes.    If you're lucky enough to dine there when the owner is in, you're likely to get a delicious special treat at the end of your meal as well, so cross your fingers and hope that's when you find yourself there.  Also, they can get quite busy during dinner hours so I've found that getting there between 5pm-5:30pm will typically get you sat right away.    Bon App√©tit!!!

My favorite pizza place in Phoenix! It's authentic Italian (they call it Napoletana) style pizza, so naturally it's incredible. The appetizers and desserts are great too. This place compares favorably with the likes of Pizzeria Bianco, and there's rarely much wait. I've rarely come and not been offered complimentary homemade limoncello as well, another plus!

Excellent, by far the best gourmet pizza in AZ. This place is everything that the other more famous pizza joints promise to be and fail to achieve.  Their sauce is robust and flavorful,  toppings are top notch, crust the perfect char.  Great, hip, downtown city atmosphere.  Friendly staff, prompt service but not rushed. Thank you for finally bring a good pizza joint to downtown Phoenix.

This pizza is delicious!! Found it through Yelp and all the reviews are spot on. I ordered a Margherita and it was perfect. The amount of cheese was more than enough, and there wasn't a ton of sauce to overpower it. If I lived in Phoenix, I would eat here all the time! The only thing was the service was a little slow for a somewhat empty restaurant which was disappointing. Either way, would eat here again!
the best, most authentic, real Italian pizza I found in the United States! I felt like I was back in Italy!

Service was amazing! I'm a bit of a north east Italian pizza snob and I am very pleased!! The pizza is high quality, great selection and super reasonably priced unlike some other yummy spots in town. We will surely be back!!
This is my most favorite pizza in town. Complementary limoncello and crispy sweet are good to finish the meal.

My son and I loved this place.  The pizza is delicious and the desserts are fabulous.  My ten year old son decided to try a white pizza and he was converted from red sauce immediately. The service was also very helpful and attentive.

If you have been Italy and enjoyed their pizza, then you have experienced Pomo! If you have not been to Italy  and eaten pizza, then you must try Pomo. They use truly authentic ingredients and they have have a wood stove that was  brought from Naples, Italy.   The pizza crust is full of flavor and the toppings are so amazing. Fresh mozzarella, prosciutto, spicy salmi and many other tasty toppings.  In addition, their appetizers are also amazing. Fresh buffalo mozzarella, tomatoes and some field greens make a perfect start to your meal.   After you eat your delightful pizza, then try their simply tasty desserts.  We tried their deep fried dough sprinkled with powdered sugar. Simple but yet a great way top off your meal.   In addition, we also tried the homemade limoncello. It was pure delight! Just like the limoncello my mother makes.  A perfect way to cap off the dining experience.    Oh yeah, I almost forgot, the owner and chef, Matteo, was extremely hospitable  as was the wait staff.  If you are looking for a way eat like you are in Italy without spending all the time and money to get there, eat at Pomo's and you will at least et a very authentic meal and you can wash it down with a nice glass of Perroni.    I can't wait to head back to Phoenix so I can get another taste of Italy.  I only wish they would deliver to Cincinnati!

This is the first time I am writing a review but when you try something new and it is simply amazing, how can you not want to tell the world?  My boyfriend is currently working in downtown Phoenix and I am getting a mini-vacation so my only job is finding places close by for dinner.  I often turn to yelpers for suggestions and thank you!  After reviewing the menu, our super sweet waitress, Ciara, was our go to decider.  Gotta love when the wait staff is honest and can help you with more than just making sure your drinks don't run out.  We started with Romana salad.  It was very close to a Caesar salad which when done right is one of boyfriend's favs.  The lettuce was crisp and no browning so very fresh.  The dressing coated every piece and yet  it was not heavy at all.    My bf is a major carnivore.  So when it comes to pizza, the greater the portion of meat equals greater happiness in his world.  That being said, we ordered the Toto Sapore pizza.  I typically have some kind of veggie on my pizza but I couldn't fault this choice one bit.  That pizza could probably make a vegetarian cry in their pillow at night!  Even though the crust may be said to be charred by some, the fact that I was eating a crust as thin as that and yet able to retain that softness you get from a "regular" one was like a miracle. The sauce was beautiful and not over seasoned.  It tasted like tomato!  We were tempted to order another but since we had salad and wanted dessert, we nixed that idea.  That had to one of the best decisions that we made.  I can't spell it for the life of me but that dessert melted my heart and worth every calorie it had.  It was these beautiful cream puffs covered in a rich chocolate mousse surrounded by clouds of another sweetened cream.   Overall, living in south Chandler, I would easily make the trek to return to this place.  Though next time, I am gonna skip lunch so I can have the room for more pizza!!

Wow what a treat.  I make pizza at home once a week at home in Austin from scratch and after a long time have I found one I can say tops mine in crust. There are many pizzerias that have wood fired brick oven pizzas but here everything was perfect. The Panna Cotta and their espresso was another treat to top off with. Too authentic. When the server told me that the owners have everything "certified" it was not hard to believe. I am sure to stop there next time I am in Phoenix.

Stopped in for a late lunch at about 1:40pm, not realizing they close at 2pm.  My daughter and I ordered a salad and pizza to split and while we were eating our salad I noticed about 5 employees staring at us.  Like consistently staring to the point I was uncomfortable.   I realized then that we were the only table left and they were closed.  I asked the waitress and she confirmed they closed at 2pm but not to worry because she has nowhere to be and we could take our time.   After we finished our salad we had two people immediately clear everything from our table.  Thought it was odd but figured they would re-set it before the pizza comes.  A few mins later a lady came back and was very rude and said that she thought we were leaving and re-set the table.    Our pizza came and everyone was still staring and made us feel so uncomfortable that we shoveled the pizza down and got the check.  Again, our table was cleared so quickly and it was very obvious they were rushing us out.  It was 2:15pm when I paid and we left, not that far past closing.    I don't know how to rate the food, we ate it so quickly that we barely tasted it.  I think the pizza might have been fabulous but it really sucks I couldn't enjoy it.  I paid $30 for lunch (including tip) and I couldn't enjoy it and am now stuck with horrible indigestion from eating so quickly.    Lesson learned, don't go right before closing!  If I go back,  I will re-review this place and hopefully give it more stars!
