My husband and I were first timers here yesterday for lunch.  We ordered the arugula/ buffalo appetizer and the buffalo mozzarella pizza. This place is the real deal! Totally authentic pizza with imported flour, tomatoes, cheese and oregano to mention a few.  My husband is from Rome and the flavors brought him back to Italy. The owner Matteo is a fantastic host and really knows his craft! You will not be disappointed with anything you order!

Upon the recommendation from the "foodie guy" at a conference, I ate at Pomo Pizza with a bunch of people I met. The pizza margarita was super tasty. I could really taste the fresh tomato sauce and mozzarella.  The waiter gave us a free dessert of fried dough strips with powdered sugar to go. Loved it.

I know everyone loves Pomo, but I have had mixed experiences. I've had pizzas that were delicious here (usually the more plain pizzas), but I've had a couple that were not so good. Additionally, their lasagna was not my fave (a bit on the greasy side). Their prices are a bit high, and I understand they have high quality imported ingredients, but there are other similar restaurants with better prices and better flavor.

My friend is a huge pizza lover and this is one of her favorite places that she wanted to take me and I see why!! Everything was amazing.   I ordered the  Capricciosa pizza. This comes with Prosciutto Cotto, Gaeta Olives, Artichoke, and  Mushroom. I loved it! Everything was amazing except I wasn't a big fan of the olives. I washed it down with the Pinot Noir wine which was delicious.   Not only was the pizza delicious but what makes the place is the customer service. Maurizio did such a great job. He always made sure that we got everything we needed and was so friendly and funny! Ask for him when you come here!   So you got good food, good drinks and good customer service right? What else can top that? How about the owner coming around with free shots that he made! Um what!? What restaurant do you know that comes around your table giving you free shots!!?? Not to mention we also got free desert! This place was such a cute little spot for a date or even with friends for a great night of pizza and wine. =)

Ordered a large pizza and husband goes in all seriousness "what is THIS? A pizza for ants??" Lol. Total appropriate response in quoting Zoolander. The pizza tasted pretty decent for being in AZ but this pizza was tiny. 6 extremely thin slices for a large. We were still starving after. I'm still convinced only New England know how's to do proper pizza, especially NY.

The pizza here was tasty, but I did wish the crust wasn't so soggy/oily.  I like my crust more crispy, at least where I can pick up a slice with one hand without the slice falling apart.    I do have to mention that the service as excellent and the restaurant itself had nice decor and was very clean.    Recommendations:  Quattro and Totto  The complimentary dessert was also a nice simple treat :)  I think I would come back, and just simply ask them to keep mine in the oven a little longer.

Third time I've been here.   Fantastic food.   My problem was the service. My problem was when our waiter asked how everything was going and if we needed anything. In mid sentence the waiter noticed the college girl next to us was raising her hand for his attention (yes, like grade school hand raising) and he completely dismissed us and catered to her. He brought out her request and then got back to us.   Point being, we felt very disrespected.

Pomo, I  you.  Came in for lunch on a Saturday.  Ordered the Regina Margherita and the panna cotta for dessert.  Every single bite was perfect!  The people are nice, the restaurant is clean.    The Regina Margherita is one of the best I tried.  They provide a bottle of olive oil on the table which I did use to drizzle on each slice.  It made my pizza extra juicy.  The pizza is fantastic on its own though.  I ordered the panna cotta, something I always wanted to try.  It came out plated beautifully with fruits and fried bread with powdered sugar.  Amazing!!  I would give Pomo 10 stars if I could.

I truly wish I could give more than a 5-star review to Pomo. We began going there when they still had the Borgata location. Living downtown, that was always a bit of a hike, but it was worth it. Now that they're downtown I feel like my life is complete.   We are very fortunate to have some world class pizzerias downtown and around Central Phoenix. With one exception, I've tried them all numerous times. Obviously any review is opinion-based, but I would whole-heartedly say that Pomo is the superior of them all. I've never had anything that was not absolutely delicious here. I've yet to try their panini and pasta, but the pizza, salads, calzone, and desserts are all out of this world. Dessert-wise, the semifreddo is the one we come back to most often. The Romana salad is always a great way to start. Pizza-wise, the carbonara is a rich little treasure that deserves your attention. The diavola is spicy, but well-balanced, and is another "must." Really, you could probably close your eyes and pick randomly and be so far from disappointed you'd find yourself in a foreign land.   At the end of every meal the owner brings out powdered sugar covered fried pieces of dough that are almost paper thin. At dinner these are also accompanied by homemade limoncello that is syrupy thick and delicious. There's even a cinnamon version that you will thank your lucky stars you were fortunate enough to try should it be available.   So Pomo, from the bottom of my heart, thank you for doing what you're doing. I can't wait to spend more time enjoying your fare, and I wish you unlimited success!

Just got to experience this place for the first time last night and it was delicious!  I tried the PRINCIPE pizza and it was so perfect with prosciutto, arugula, and parm!  All my favorite things!  Service was super fast, cute location, and I thought the complimentary dessert and limoncello were a nice touch.  I'll definitely come here again!

Never thought I'd ever say or admit this but the pizza here is better than any I've had in New York City and that says a lot considering I grew up on pizza. Typically you'll see coal oven pizza, this uses wood....good wood (that's what she said - I know.)  This place has legitimate Napoli (Neapolitan) pizza! The owner is from Napoli and as Italian as it gets. Ingredients are fresh and high quality.   There are three other locations in the nearby Phoenix area, I've only tried this location but assume they're all wonderful. The owner is sweet and attentive, I've seen him pass by every table in there and the bar and talk to patrons as well as offer them shots of Limoncello, that says a lot about him as a person and a business owner.  Go now.

Inconsistent: I've been to Pomo twice. The first time had excellent service; however my pizza was a bit burnt and the dessert was just absolutely awful. I also ordered a mixed salad, which was nothing special but at $10 I would have expected something a little more.   My second experience at Pomo: the service was horrible. I sat for almost 10 min without someone stopping by to take my order. No one came by for a good 10+ min after I was finished with the pizza and I was in such a hurry I just gave them my credit card to run the bill. When I got the check back (after an unacceptably long wait) I noticed they ran through the wrong pizza and then charged me an additional $6 for mushrooms. I was in too much of a hurry to tell them and they wouldn't have returned for 15 min anyways. In total, 1 pizza cost me $27 not including tip. The pizza was good but absolutely not worth $27.   Overall, I'm conflicted on whether or not I will return. I don't want to go back there due to my bad experience but since I stay downtown during the week and it's within walking distance from my hotel, I may return.   One thing I definitely want to eat again is their tomato sauce. I would buy it in jars if they sold it. It is some of the best I've ever had. Also.. the mushrooms they charged me an additional $6 for (when I ordered their mushroom pizza, which comes with mushrooms).. anyways, they were delicious.

So I got food delivered from here and the pizza was mediocre but the pasta was pretty good. That could have been enough for a three star review but then I opened the tiramisu, omfg!!!! The mascarpone was rotten like sour and miserable tasting. It even looked off when I opened the box. I have pretty low standards on just life in general and don't expect much outside of maybe ordering food that isn't old and nasty. Seriously I just got out of freaking prison and when your tiramisu makes me long for prison grade desserts your restaurant has a fundamental flaw if that will even leave your kitchen. I called and talked to the manager and he seemed to know about the issue like this has happened before and on numerous occasions. I don't want gift cards or a free meal, I just want to have faith in a restaurant that when I am ordering I can get edible food, plus i was on a date at someone else's freaking house!!! How do you recover from that?? The manager was pretty funny though when I talked to him, his thick accent made me remember all the good Italian food restaurants that used to exist in Phoenix. So in closing I give up!  Edit: they did reach out and seem legitimately apologetic and hopefully this issue won't happen again. The restaurant industry is hard and nothing will ever be perfect but it is nice that when mistakes are made they want to rectify it.

Our favorite hang out place. I seriously love the limoncello. I can't seem to figure out the recipe. Lol. We'll keep coming back at least twice a month since we live in Goodyear. Thank you for the awesome memories we create when we visit this place.
Great service. Excellent food. Quick. And owner gave us free drink at the end. Definitely will come again. Bravo!!!!

Their pizza... oh my... just amazing! The Peppino is my favorite and my husband loves the Toto Sappore. They have an excellent lasagna bolognese and limoncello. The only reason why I can't give this place a 5 star is because their appetizers/desserts are not very good, and we have tried plenty. Hopefully, they will revamp those parts of the menu or just take those sections off and make the pizzas cheaper ;) Other than that, this is my favorite pizza place by far!
5 star food, service and experience for a 2 star price! You don't find that very often. Love this place. Thank you Dave at the bar. We would eat breakfast here too if they were open for it.

A cute little bistro with a delightful European feel, Pomo seems like a good place for a drink and/or pizza. I stopped in for a glass of wine and a late-night snack with my husband. We spit the sorrentina appetizer which is grape tomato bruschetta with a base layer of melted mozzarella. The two large pieces were enough to split. The Syrah I had was wonderful, and my husband enjoyed a glass of chianti reserva. Both of us reminisced on our trip to Italy last year and enjoyed the beautiful patio on a surprisingly cool September evening in Phoenix. We didn't have a chance to try the pizza, but the orders for other tables made us want to come back to try them. The menu has lots of options for pizza and dessert as well as a lunch menu with a selection of panini. The service was a little slow getting the check but this may have been because we were taking a while to enjoy our wines. It's a little on the pricey end with wine by the glass averaging $8-$9 but the pizzas seemed worth the price at $12-$16 with several couples nearby splitting just one pizza. Overall, a great find for what we wanted, and we will be back again to try the pizza.

Well I was a little skeptical at first reading previous reviews. Came in it was busy I think we had the lunch crowd, however coming in we were seated pretty quickly I ordered the grambina and rocalua I believe it's was called, delicious shrimp and arugula and in almost what felt like 10 seconds flat this pizza was down depending on ur hunger level if u order a 12 inch pizza I ate a whole on to my self so did my girlfriend so u could share one or do your own but they only reason it does not get 5 stars is due to slow service time it took a while to get our order placed and throughout the meal and at the end to get out check

I came here on a Saturday for lunch and we got it right away as there weren't many people. I came in here determined to eat a nice salad to go right along with my diet, ahem, "lifestyle change."  Well, of course, that went out the window the second I stepped into this delicious establishment and caught a peek of the pizza on the table next to us.  I did end up ordering the mango salad and the Capricciosa pizza. The crust was thin, crunchy, yet soft. It had all the ingredients that lead up to perfection. More than anything, it was the great service that I was excited about. The owner came and greeted us and brought us water right away. He answered all of our questions. The server was awesome as well.   The place was very cute with a Vespa theme. I'd like to come back in the evening for dinner and see how different the ambiance is at night. I will definitely be going back to try a different pizza.

Pizza! Good Italian Pizza and fresh local ale on tap, sitting outside watching playoff basketball. Does it get any better than that? Well, yes it could, if the Suns were in the playoff, it definitely would be better (there's always next year).  I've wanted to check out this place for awhile, as it was recommended by a few fellow yelpers and since I had it bookmarked, was in the area, and I joyfully discovered their Happy Hour was still going on until 7pm...Score, as it was just 6pm, and most HH were over! So, I strolled in, and was promptly greeted, but all the bar seating was occupied, and since I was flying solo, they were going to toss me outside, but David, my capable host offered the outdoor bar seating, where he would be more than happy to open up the overhead, and allow me to enjoy the outdoors, and still feel a part of the indoor scene and catch the game. I accepted his offer as he promptly brought me menus galore...hey I just need pizza, "what's popular"?, I asked.  The "meat lovers" David identified as his go-to, and also a house favorite, so it's what I went with. The standard fare of silverware, a napkin, plate and acumens were brought out while I waited, and a wonderful tall glass of water was delivered without me having to even ask. The Toto Sapore had a load of flavor, not too cheesy, crunchy, not too thin, flavorful crust, and it came out quick, too! I also ordered a pint of the Devil's Ale, and I'm usually half way done with a brew before my pizza arrives, but not here, Wow!! Only a few swigs and I was being served...this, my first visit I just hope they're not spoiling this pizza/beer lover, but I think not.  I tend to equalize my beer consumption with beer intake, and usually polish off two pints, but because my pie came out so quickly, I almost finished it off before the first ale was consumed. Good thing, too, for I didn't want to stay for a second round, but was really enjoying the atmosphere and late spring weather. By the time I finished over two-thirds of my Toto Sapore, my glass was empty, my belly full, and I was a happy guy, and very satisfied customer. I will be back for more very soon.
This restaurant was good. I would not say it was the best I have ever had, but I was fairly happy with it. The bartender was really helpful and patient as I made my choice.

Pizza this evening out with friends we ordered 4 different pizza. Each pizza was cooked to perfection and delicious. Highly recommended if in downtown Phoenix. Best pizza you are going to find in here plus the Lemon cello is very tasty also I may add.

I am impressed! I came here on the recommendation of a friend, not knowing anything about the place and I ended up loving it. The decor is cute and modern and clean, although I can see this place getting packed because it is a small restaurant and I think it will get very popular soon.  I ordered the postafino (?) panini for lunch.  I love that it came with a small side salad with balsalmic dressing and big parmesan shavings.  Simple, lightly-dressed salads are my favorite! The panini itself was HUGE -- honestly, it's SO big.  Inside the panini was the perfect amount of melted cheese, arugula, and prosciutto.  For only $10, that panini is a great deal.  The other half of mine will be my dinner tonight.  Another plus is the olive oil and herbs/spices they bring out to dip your bread into.  They also have a spicy olive oil which is amazing.  I sprinkled some inside my panini and it gave it just the slightest kick.  I will most definitely be back, this place rocks!

The pizza here is delicious and authentic to Italy!  Thin and super crispy crust.  I had the Principe -- prosciutto with arugula and shaved parmigiano reggiano.  Delish!  Each person should get their own pie, like they do in Italy, as the size and thin crust makes it a good personal-sized pizza.  (Although I didn't eat my whole pie in one sitting, the bf scarfed down his Margherita pizza very quickly!)  As we were paying the check, the owner(?), who has a fantastic Italian accent, surprised us by bringing over a small plate of powdered sugar covered pieces of fried dough (I have no idea what they're called) and a shot of homemade limoncello for each of us.  Fantastic!  The limoncello was the perfect way to top off a great experience!  We'll definitely be back.

BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!  It was our first time there the staff was friendly the food was TO DIE FOR and they gave us dessert on the house, I'm definately going back there. I love supporting small businesses.

We visited downtown Phoenix for the Home Show and needed a place to eat. Opted for Pomo because Matt's Big Breakfast was too busy (probably why we've never been there). We had been to Pomo's Scottsdale location when they first opened and never returned because we just weren't wowed. We still weren't wowed.  I guess I'm very particular about my pizza because of my strong Italian roots. The crust was good, nice amount of char but overall just tasteless pizza. We had the Margarita Pizza and the Pizza Chef. Both good size pizzas but no distinct flavors, the tomato sauce was bland, very light in color; definitely not a hearty sauce even for pizza. If it wasn't for the prosciutto on the Chef  it would have been completely tasteless. I've been to much better pizza places in the Phoenix area.

I was told that this was the best pizza in Phoenix. The Yelp reviews make it seem like a winner. This is hands down the WORST pizza I've ever had. It was dripping more than an ice cube in the desert. I have no idea why the pizza was so moist, with the brick oven I expected a crispy and delicate pizza. But what landed on our table needed a shop vac to suck up whatever random liquid was coming from this undercooked pie. I've come to the conclusion that Arizona and its people have no idea what good food is. Enjoy your crap.

Love it here!! The pizza's are so amazing AND AUTHENTIC, come out 5 minutes after you order, and the staff is so friendly. Every dish I've tried (from the grilled veggies, to the soup, to the many pizzas) has been wonderful. It's also not absurdly pricey and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. The owner also comes around after each pizza is put out and brings the cheese and this delicious spicy olive oil. He's very friendly and loves to give you a shot of limoncelo if you're lucky!  1 pizza is great for 2 people to share. It's more fun in a bigger group where you can get a few to try all the yummies. Ingredients are top notch, the dough is fabulous, and give me all the mozzarella please! I always suggest Pomo when we're wondering what to do for dinner and can't wait to try all their pies.

Hand made, quick fire pizzas that can be customized with a respectable array of artisanal ingredients.     I had the TIROLESE with Brie' Cheese, Smoked Speck Alto Adige IGP.  This type of pizza is not my personal favorite, but what I do know is that it was cooked perfectly, and the ingredients used made it feel like I was sitting in a small village, eating cured meats and chesse from someone who had made it all themselves.  The fact that the owner was in the store cooking my pizza created that feeling of authenticity, that when paired with my italian wine (great choices from all over Italy on the menu), made it feel for just a moment like I was not in sizzling Phoenix.    To be transported away, if but only for a moment by the experience of eating food, is one of the greatest pleasures of dining, and Pomo Pizzeria gave me that experience.    A happy 4 stars.

I don't see how anyone could give this place less than 5 stars. Went here on a Friday night and it was busy, waited maybe 10 minutes before I was seated but was able to get drinks while we waited. I was amazed how quickly the ladies got the tables ready for the next customers and the owner was very much involved. We had the Roma Salad and the Margherita Pizza and my wife had the Vespa cocktail which she thought was very refreshing. Before we left we were treated with a complimentary shot of is very own limoncello. It was simply a fantastic experience and our taste buds loved it! You have to ex price this place!  Did I mention their company car is a Fiat 500? How perfect is that?

True Italian pizza and experience! I had the carbonara pizza, which is to die for. The sauce is made with egg whites and is not too over bearing like at some places. The staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this pizzeria.
Stefano, the owner, has done an amazing things with bringing us authentic Italian pizza! I have been coming here for years and wouldn't go anywhere else. The buffala is best!
Great service!! Had three different pizzas and was complimented with homemade lemon cello and powdered sugar crisps!! Fresh food and great service even during Super Bowl week!

Great!  There goes my diet. So much for that three day vodka cleanse. The pizza here is out of this world. The crust is just sublime. The cheese does not overwhelm the sauce or ingredients. I had the diabolo and my friend the shrimp and arugula. Both equally perfect in their own way. The service was a tad bit slow but still friendly and attentive. I will be going back to try out everything on the menu. And one more thing, the complimentary limoncello shot we got at the end was not only super tasty but appreciated. Nice touch!

We liked it. It's not your typical americanized pizza. It had great flavor but was a little soggy towards the center. We order the quattro stagioni and the roman salad. They served some bread before hand with some spicy oil. All in all, it was tasty.
greatest pizza i've ever had. would not recommend the cocktails tho.

Best pizza around! (This is for the downtown location only) I have been here many times, listen just give me a pizza that is fresh, not overly complicated and made with love!  And that's what they do here!!

Pizza was mediocre at best. I believe the majority of great reviews for this place are being posted by people who have not experienced classic Neapolitan style pizza in any other setting. If you are used to the pizza hut across the street then you will find this place fun and exciting with a new take on pizza flavors. However in my opinion the flavors were all wrong, the crust was very good, the sauce and topping combinations were where this pizza fell short in my opinion. The lasagna was very good but it is the only "pasta" on the menu, if you want bread with your lasagna be prepared to pay for it. Our service was horrible although I do not think this reflects on the restaurant as much as the individual who was serving us. Our drinks came out with no ice, when we questioned this we were told the ice machine was broke and they were down to there last bag. I understand things happen but it would have been nice to have been informed of this situation before they were brought to us. Overall I feel this place is trying to hard to be an upscale pizzeria and falling very short.

They don't do reservations but they do call aheads which is basically a reservation. Small but cute so be prepared to sit outside. If you're not use to a lot of true Italian ingredients you may get lost in the menu...BUT the staff is super friendly and will help you understand. Food was quite good. The only reason I gave it a 4 out of 5 was the atmosphere of workers not quite sure what to do. Party of 7, no seating... Where do we sit them? At the bar. Where did walk carry out customer go.. I don't know. Who fills the ice? Apprehensive about asking who gets bill. It just seemed like they were brand new.. Maybe they were. Overall good place to eat!

Went on Tuesday night, pleasantly suprised, got a nice bottle of wine 1/2 off and a great pizza, David the bar tender, was fantastic great recommendation of the pie, nice ambience,  great people,  awesome food,  a must go and check out.

I read that this was one of the best restaurants in Phoenix, and rushed from the airport to get there before they closed. Major disappointment, or maybe I just went to the wrong place. Hip pizzeria with great, friendly service, but the pizza was leathery with a funky, unpleasant taste. We each had one piece, and tho' we were hungry, we tossed the rest!. Hated to waste a great bottle of Seghesio Zin on that pizza, but maybe it saved the evening from a complete disaster. It didn't appear that one could really custom order your pie from a variety of ingredients. If you choose to ignore my warning at least check the menu first. Expensive (gotta pay for hip, right?)

What a fantastic dining experience from the very first impression to the last. The entire experience was just terrific. I had called earlier in the day to get directions and parking information. The woman on the phone was just so wonderful and friendly. I was happy that my first impression was starting out just great. From the moment we walked in we were made to feel like family.  As an Italian restaurant should and is usually so good at. (Hint, hint to other vendors in town) The pizza here is totally, radically delish and I am very picky about Pizza. Pomo's is one of only two places in town to be certified in the making of authentic Italian style Napoletana pizza. Even with the burnt crust, which I am never a fan of, the pizza was still wonderful.      We also ordered the Flatbread App ( Loaded with garlic and the size of a pizza, so heads up) and the Caprese Salad ( Delish). For dessert we ordered The Tiramisu, and the Creme Puffs with Mousse. The Creme Puffs were light and airy and yummy.  The Tiramisu was one of the best two I have ever had. I have eaten a lot in my life since it is my favorite dessert.      Now the impressive part to make me homesick.  As we were sitting and digesting our carb load and contemplating a roll out to my car one of the owners came to our table to say hi. Besides being an extremely handsome Italian, friendly, and chatty he had a bottle of Limoncello in his hands. My version of the perfect man. Hello, but I digress. He served us complimentary shots of their version of Limoncello.  It has an Icee creamy texture to it. It took me a minute and a few tries but in the end I decided I liked it very much despite the unusual texture for this drink. It was very inventive and I love food inventions/experimentation. I believe he said he adds heavy cream and some other ingredient to it to make it thicker. He also gave us a sample of deep friend dough strips with powered sugar. it was kind of like a Zeppole but flatter and harder. The owner walked the floor chatting with his guests making them feel at home. Now that is the type of Italian restaurant I remember from the old neighborhood.

Whaddup fam. I walked into this place in an Uptown Funk type of mood. A few coworkers and I had one of those Secret Santa shindigs and we had to come to a quorum on a place that could satisfy and satiate a diverse set of palates. So we settled on Pomo, and since it was a Friday night, we called ahead of time and had a table prepared for us. We entered that joint like Bruno Mars and his crew at the beginning of Uptown Funk - we were fly.  I look back on it now, and I now realize in hindsight that I was unwittingly having my Last Supper moment with them. I ain't Jesus, nor were any of them endowed with otherworldly powers, but it was the last time we all broke bread together; and I am happy to say it was a delightfully memorable experience.   Phoenix has Fired Pie, Dominoes, Little Caesar's, hell it has Digiorno if those commercials really hit a nerve and you actually wanna pass that off as delivery (Tombstone better IMO.) Pomo towers above those brands. I am a pretty simple guy so I always get pepperoni, but my bros and gals got dishes that completed the entire spectrum of colors that the human eye can comprehend.  My pizza was stellar. So stellar that I was thinking about eating half there and saving the rest for the weekend. Note I went there on a Friday. That pizza is so good you wanna divvy up the rest of it for a fun weekend. It could be a "hey I've known you for three years and just asked you on a date food," or it's 3am and my head feels like Alan's after he got hit by Tyson in the Hangover. As far as I know, my crew shared similar sentiments.  Now on to cost. When you are getting high-end stuff, you pay a bit more. So make sure you are ready to take hammer to your poor piggy bank. Also, topic switch, the general mood. The place is chill. It's the Jason Bourne of restaurants. From the staff to the chairs it's calm, collected, and cordial. This all coalesces in a way to ensure you're able to have a good time with the right people. It's also quite close to De Soto and the rest of downtown, so it's in good walking distance if this is the first stop before many.  There was one drawback. One drawback which took away that 5 star spot. The bread. Fam, I've been to Red Lobster and have had 3 servings of those cheddar biscuits and have tried to get out of paying the bill. I mean damn, I've been to a Chinese restaurant that was once an Opera theatre that served baller bread. Oddly though, the bread here doesn't cause one to salivate. I don't know all the facts behind this bread. Maybe an investigation by the F.B.I. needs to be launched to deduce why the bread here doesn't compare to lesser establishments.   But everything considered, Pomo is dope AF. I got to have one last hoorah with a group of people that I have ended up cherishing like Jesus cherished his disciples. Pomo is only 4 stars for me because I am really picky about bread - I own that pickiness. But for most it will likely be 5 stars. Don't waste your time with pizza that shames the name. Get down to Pomo and chow down.

Trendy place to eat. Very friendly and cute location. Our waitress was from our home town in California!  Go Giants!   Good pizza and great house wine. Hostess did exactly what he was supposed to do and insure we were having a good dinner. Found a new place to dine when in Phoenix again. Highly recommended. Great customer service!

Came here on a random Friday night after bookmarking it awhile ago after seeing the glowing reviews. When we pulled up via pedicab, we realized this was the place they had been working on the last time we ventured into SquashBlossom. The patio area looked nice but it was way too hot that night to sit outside so we opted for the dinning room.  When we walked in, the place was nearly full but we were greeted and sat near the back wall at a small table. Our waitress was friendly and we both ordered cocktails that were really good. We opted to get the Focaccia bread as an appetizer and then share the Mango Salad and Peppino pizza. I requested that the Mango salad be made with other greens besides arugula. As I mentioned in the Zpizza review, since when has this crappy, peppery green become so fashionable?!?! If I want my salad to taste like an herb, I'll add it, thank you very much. When I asked for a substitution with one of the other greens listed on the menu, our waitress said they couldn't really do it, that the salads were pre-made. I probably should have opted for a different salad but she said it was a blend so I thought I could probably overlook it if there wasn't a lot of it.  We received a basket of bread that was just okay in flavor. It was nice and soft though and at first I thought it was the Focaccia appetizer but then it arrived, nearly taking up our whole table! It wasn't quite what I had expected though. It was definitely flatbread that had been baked but the waitress advertised it as being able to be dipped in their homemade vinegar and oil. That's what sold me on it so I had expected some bread that actually soaked up the oil. If you've ever had a salad at Gelato spot, it was a lot like their bread under their salads. Picture a really big, baked tortilla. There's not a lot there to soak up anything.   Our salad came out next. Sadly, 10% was baby lettuce and the rest arugula. Everything else on this salad was really good but the arugula overpowered every other flavor. I wouldn't get it again and it would be nice if restaurants stopped serving this crap but I digress...  By the time we were done with our salads, our table was overflowing with dishes, drinks, bread, appetizers, water glasses, oils. It was almost claustrophobic. We ended up setting several things on the floor so we didn't dump anything. The place is tiny so they can't have massive tables but it would be helpful if the staff paid a bit more attention to how much they put on our table and keeping it clear.   Now for the reason for the 4 stars. The PIZZA. It was sooooo good. Everything was super fresh. The cheese, the ricotta, the sauce, the sausage! This was probably the best tasting sausage I've ever had on a pizza. We devoured the entire thing like it was going to be snatched from us at any moment. It blows Pizzeria Bianco out of the water and eases out over Cibo with the crust and sauce and toppings just slightly.  Once we sufficiently stuffed ourselves with pizza, the head chef came by our table and gave us each a shot of Limoncello that was super strong and really good and some odd fried dough of some sort with powdered sugar. All compliments of the house. The dough was tasteless though so maybe they were just trying to give it away? I do appreciate the effort though. The chef was nice enough to bring it over but definitely wasn't overly friendly, smile or even thanked us for our business.   Even after all the other faults of this place, I'm still thinking about that pizza and its been a few weeks since we visited. I'll have no problem going back. Hopefully very soon!
